author: {'steamid': '76561198043911261', 'num_games_owned': 659, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1567372587}
review:
Basic mayonnaise: Recipes

Ingredients
2 egg yolks
1 tbsp Dijon mustard
250ml sunflower oil
2 tsp white wine vinegar or lemon juice

First Step: Tip the egg yolks and mustard into a bowl, season with salt and pepper and whisk together until completely combined. Whisking constantly, add a small drop of oil and whisk until completely combined, then add another drop and continue a drop at a time until the yolks and oil combine and start to thicken. Once you‚Äôre confident the oil and eggs are coming together you can add the oil a bit more at a time, but be patient, as adding the oil too quickly will cause the mayonnaise to split and curdle.

Second Step: Once all the oil has been whisked into the eggs and you have a thick, spoonable mayonnaise, whisk in the vinegar or lemon juice and season to taste. Will keep in the fridge for two days.

author: {'steamid': '76561199572661419', 'num_games_owned': 408, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 121, 'last_played': 1708972385}
review:
[h2] Click On This Jar of Mayo for A Few Surprises [/h2]
I‚Äôm currently on a trip, and I thought, what would be a good short game to play as I relax? Well, one such game was this. In ways, I‚Äôve always wanted to play this, even though it‚Äôs an effortless experience.

In [i]My Name is Mayo[/i], all players need to do is click on a jar of mayo and, in the process, receive achievements that add costumes and different looks to the mayo jar, like Catsup, an emo phase, and so much more. That‚Äôs all there is for this Cookie Clicker type of game. However, I still had a good two hours of fun playing through. The game's art style is very 1950s, which I think was neat. I liked the comedy element of this game, too, as I found myself chuckling at various looks for the mayo. Another nice touch was how self-aware this game is, which adds a level of charm. One thing I do want to stress is to make sure you take breaks when clicking on the jar. Don‚Äôt want to break one‚Äôs mouse or your spacebar or even cause potential problems in your fingers.

I saw that two other sequels were made, so I‚Äôll have to check them out in the future. But, overall, while this may be an overly simple experience, it was still enjoyable. It's not too serious, but it doesn't need to be.
[h1] 4 out of 5 ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ! [/h1]

review:
This is a one-handed game, but you can play with both hands by pressing the mouse and spacebar at the same time. 
 

My Name is Mayo is a clicker game, we have 3 types of clickers to choose from: watch hand, ring finger and skeleton hand
    A big advantage is the competition mode - the game has rankings in which we can compete with other players/friends and try to beat their score.
Unlock random facts!
Discover 4 different stories!
Unlock 50 unique achievements!
Collect handmade Steam trading cards!
The game has 50 achievements , I recommend FelicesEpicThug

author: {'steamid': '76561199010042150', 'num_games_owned': 3874, 'num_reviews': 2454, 'playtime_forever': 215, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 214, 'last_played': 1706880706}
review:
I am 32 years old.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and we adopted our son together. Both are now 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I felt lost and unhappy. I was self-destructive. One day, I was so angry with everything spiraling out of control that I punched a concrete wall in a moment of overwhelming emotion. This resulted in breaking my fifth metacarpal in my right hand‚Äîthe hand I worked with, played games with, and used to carry my children to bed‚Äîthe hand I desperately needed to ensure I could continue providing.

Upon learning the severity of the self-inflicted damage, I became almost suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man, with no history of depression or anxiety. I had never experienced anger outbursts, nor was I the type to break down and cry, but I was in a tough situation that truly prevented me from seeing the light on the other side.

With nothing better to do, I looked for a game I could play WITH ONE HAND while recovering. Somehow, I stumbled upon this game and read some of the comments. I decided it was worth a try... I must admit I didn't beat the game, nor did I play as much as some of you. In fact, I may have played this game for only a day or two. That being said, after doing so, I had a new joy and hope for life. I managed to leave behind the pain and suffering that had been thrust upon me. I could experience the joy and happiness of other people. I relaxed for 5 ‚ô•‚ô•‚ô•‚ô• minutes listening to this music, long enough to realize that I would be okay.

After realizing this, I turned off the game and went back to work. My hand hurt a lot, but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so sorry for myself and became the father I needed to be at that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving like.

Today, I am close friends with the mother of my children. We don't fight, argue, or say hurtful things to each other. We are parents and friends.

Now I have 3 children. My third child is, wait, ALSO 4 YEARS OLD. The woman I am with was going through a very similar situation at the time of my separation, and we just unexpectedly stumbled into each other's lives. We have been dating for a year and are very happy together.

Moral of the story: you never know what life has in store for you, and if I had given up when all odds were against me, I wouldn't be where I am today. This silly little game helped me realize that.

Thank you.

review:
A fun little filler game where you mash and click your mouse button to open a jar of mayo, filled with little side stories and silly antics to fulfill until you reach 10.000 clicks! Which is the main endgame goal. You can use natural clicking which takes almost 1-2 hours to complete or with an auto-clicker if you have less care but nobody judges you!

Fun and old game, love it and miss these genre of games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198967061346', 'num_games_owned': 66, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1682216563}
review:
"Upon meticulous examination of the interactive experience titled 'My Name is Mayo,' I find myself compelled to offer a discerning analysis. The game, while seemingly simplistic in nature, deftly navigates the delicate balance between satire and interactivity. Its minimalist design, characterized by a singular mayonnaise jar as the focal point, serves as a canvas for the player's actions, which primarily involve repetitive tapping.

In an era dominated by elaborate narratives and complex gameplay mechanics, 'My Name is Mayo' emerges as a unique anomaly, challenging conventional paradigms by embracing a deliberate lack of depth. Its charm lies in the ironic juxtaposition between the banality of the gameplay and the subtle, tongue-in-cheek commentary it presents on the broader gaming landscape.

The narrative, if one may loosely employ the term, unfolds through quirky, text-based snippets that accompany each tap on the mayo jar. These morsels of prose, laden with absurdity and whimsy, serve as a testament to the developer's penchant for subversion. The absence of a traditional plot allows the player to project their interpretations onto the experience, resulting in a peculiar form of player-driven storytelling.

Visually, the game adheres to a deliberately rudimentary aesthetic, favoring simplicity over graphical prowess. The intentionally crude animations and limited color palette further underscore the game's commitment to its satirical agenda. This deliberate choice, while potentially divisive, contributes to the game's overall identity and reinforces its subversive narrative.

In conclusion, 'My Name is Mayo' is a noteworthy addition to the gaming landscape, not for its technical prowess or narrative complexity, but for its audacious departure from established norms. Its brevity, simplicity, and irreverence may not resonate with all audiences, yet it undeniably succeeds in carving a niche for itself within the broader spectrum of interactive entertainment. As a satirical commentary on the medium, it stands as a testament to the diverse forms that gaming can assume in the hands of innovative developers."

author: {'steamid': '76561198314396427', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 42, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1696527425}
review:
A Hilariously Simple Clicker Gem

Rating: ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÖ‚òÜ

My Name is Mayo is a delightful surprise in the world of clicker games. It's incredibly short and straightforward, yet it manages to captivate with its hilarious simplicity. The concept may sound odd (you're literally clicking on a jar of mayo), but the game's quirky sense of humor, amusing costumes, and catchy music make it an oddly satisfying experience.

What sets My Name is Mayo apart is its self-awareness. It knows it's a clicker game and doesn't take itself seriously, and that's where the charm lies. The costumes and achievements add an extra layer of fun, encouraging you to keep clicking and uncovering more surprises.

While it won't provide hours of gameplay, it's a fantastic game for short bursts of entertainment and a good laugh. My Name is Mayo is proof that even the simplest games can bring joy and amusement when done right. If you're looking for something quick, fun, and a little bit silly, give this mayo jar a click.

review:
This game may seem like your average clicker, but you'd be wrong to think that. It has so much more. The emotional roller coaster, snippets from the life of a lonely and questioning jar of mayo, and even some saucy bits (yeah I did that). 

It doesn't take long, is generally pretty enjoyable, and MAYO. Buy it if you too want to be Mayo.

review:
TLDR:  I came for the absurdity... I stayed for the story.

I added this game as filler, to hit a discount thresh-hold.  But the life lessons it has taught me; priceless!
It must be experienced, not told.

So the next time your boss yells at you, look them straight in the eyes and say "My Name is MAYO"... then walk away.

review:

Bu basit mekanik sayesinde, oyuncular mayonez kavanozunun hikayesini ortaya √ßƒ±karacak ve potansiyel olarak ondan √∂ƒüreneceklerdir.

My Name is Mayo'da oyuncular, ana amacƒ±n mayonez kavanozuna dokunmak olduƒüu bir tƒ±klama macerasƒ±na katƒ±lƒ±yor. Oyuncular dokunduk√ßa, ke≈üfedilecek toplam 50 benzersiz ba≈üarƒ±ya kadar √ße≈üitli ba≈üarƒ±larƒ±n kilidini a√ßacaklar. My Name is Mayo'nun basit bir mayonez kavanozuna dokunma eylemine odaklanarak benzersiz ve alƒ±≈üƒ±lmadƒ±k bir oyun konsepti sunduƒüunu belirtmek √∂nemlidir. Oyun, ba≈üarƒ±mlar, hikayeler ve liderlik tablolarƒ± aracƒ±lƒ±ƒüƒ±yla eƒülenceli bir deneyim sunarken basitliƒüini benimsiyor.

author: {'steamid': '76561199229029019', 'num_games_owned': 4540, 'num_reviews': 77, 'playtime_forever': 201, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1683339003}
review:
If you're looking for a game that will challenge your reflexes, your strategic thinking, and your sanity, then My Name is Mayo is definitely not the game for you. But if you're looking for a game where you can mindlessly click on a Mayo Jar, with no apparent reason and forgettable outcome, then look no further! (But then again, you'd better see a doctor).

The gameplay is simple: you click on a Mayo jar. And then you click on it again. And again. And again. Repeat ad nauseam. Oh, and if you get bored of clicking on the Mayo jar, you can also play a minigame where you're a flying cake, smacking flies out of the air. Because apparently, that's a thing.

The graphics are... honestly pleasant. They're reminiscent of old-school pin-up girl posters, except instead of sultry women, you get a Mayo jar. Yum. And speaking of yum, the sound effects are top-notch. Every click on the Mayo jar is like music to your ears, if music was made entirely out of the sound of a Mayo jar being tapped.

All in all, My Name is Mayo is a game that defies logic, sanity, and basic human dignity. But hey, at least you can say you clicked a Mayo jar ten thousand times. And really, isn't that what (your) life's all about?

author: {'steamid': '76561198003495409', 'num_games_owned': 447, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 56, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1681328598}
review:
Das obz√∂ne Mayoglas mit dem roten Deckel l√§sst mich nicht los. Vor einigen Jahren verbrachte ich schon mal eine Stunde mit dem Glas, um mir auf meiner PS Vita eine leichte Platin-Troph√§e zu erschleichen. Vor kurzem ist es mir bei Steam wieder √ºber den Bildschirm gekommen. Aus irgendeinem Grund hab ich f√ºr 99 Cent wieder zugegriffen. Ohne zu √ºberlegen. 

Das Spielprinzip ist immer noch das gleiche. Man klickt hinter einander weg auf das Glas um, wie einige hier meinen, den Inhalt zum explodieren zu bringen. Zumindest passiert nach dem 10.000sten Klick was mit dem roten Deckel. Wann das passiert oder besser ob √ºberhaupt, kann ich selbst beim zweiten Spieldurchgang nicht sagen.

Nur wenige der Erfolge blopen f√ºr eine gewisse Anzahl Klicks auf. Alle anderen muss man Ausw√§hlen und weiter klicken, bis man wiederum neue Erfolge freischaltet. Dabei erlebt man 4 kurze Geschichten √ºber Mayonnaise und ihre Auswirkungen. Was der eigentliche Sinn der Erfolge ist. 

Das Klicken liest sich einfacher als es ist. Am Ende sind alle 10 Finger erm√ºdet, K√∂rper und Geist sowieso. Ich war zwischendurch kurz davor eine Pause zu machen, um ein Sch√§fchen zu halten. Die Aussicht darauf 100% bei den Erfolgen zu schaffen, lie√ü mich aber durchhalten.

Jetzt leg ich mich erstmal hin und empfehle das Spiel f√ºr alle die was f√ºr ihr Ausdauertraining in den Fingern brauchen. Vielleicht klicke ich noch weiter um in der renommierten Bestenliste aufzusteigen. üí™

1. Edit: Nicht zu vergessen, es gibt auch noch 5 fettige Sammelkarten um das Steam-Level in die H√∂he zu treiben.

2. Edit: Nach durchforsten der Bestenliste ist mir aufgefallen das bei 2,147,483,647 Klicks, vermutlich Cheaterrei, das Endlevel erreicht ist. Ob dann endlich was explodiert konnte ich nicht herausfinden. Ich bleibe aber dran...

author: {'steamid': '76561198124437671', 'num_games_owned': 428, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 380, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 367, 'last_played': 1681387362}
review:
"My Name is Mayo" is a game that can be described as unusual and simple, yet highly addictive. The gameplay consists of clicking on a jar of mayonnaise, which has various quirky labels, in order to earn points and unlock new outfits for the jar.

While there is not much substance or depth to the game, it's clear that it was not intended to be taken seriously. The game seems to be more of a joke or a parody of clicker games, rather than a serious attempt at creating a compelling gaming experience.

Overall, "My Name is Mayo" is an entertaining distraction, but it won't provide a significant challenge or satisfy players looking for a deep and engaging gameplay experience. Therefore, I would give this game a 6/10 rating.

author: {'steamid': '76561198265719987', 'num_games_owned': 434, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 543, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 543, 'last_played': 1561610841}
review:
Ingredients:
1 tablespoon of mayo
2 slices bread of sourdough, white bread, Texas toast
1-2 slices of cheese American or cheddar

Instructions:
Spread mayo on one side of each slice of bread.
Warm skillet to medium heat. Place one slice of bread mayonnaise side down, top with cheese and a second slice of bread mayonnaise side up.
Grill 2-21/2 minutes until bread is slightly golden in color. Use a spatula to flip.
Grill other side 2-21/2 minutes until golden brown.

review:
After 20+ minutes of spam clicking. I finally 100% this game.

Not much to it.. just click the jar.. earn achievement. Select newly acquired achievement. Dress up the mayo jar... Click the Jar and repeat. Very simple and straight forward. No story, barely any music, nice sound effect, dress us mayo jar simulator. Just run this game.. click 10,000 times. Get all the achievement then exit the game forever.

review: So I saw this in a JackSepticEye video during lockdown with my girlfriend. One thing led-to-another and we decided to play the game along side the video. The simple premise around the game is do certian goals, unlock costumes for the Mayo, complete the game. Was a fun experience, and most importantly has an easy 50 achievements to be unlocked at a cheap price. If you're like me and love getting achievements, this is worth a small purchase!

author: {'steamid': '76561197965215267', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 62, 'last_played': 1665083628}
review: I am a 45 yo mother, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single mother to my Son, who is 3 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my husband had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

author: {'steamid': '76561198349857022', 'num_games_owned': 3008, 'num_reviews': 247, 'playtime_forever': 207, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1665243843}
review:
[h1] The Perfect Game If You Want Arthritis [/h1]

My Name is Mayo is a game where you click a jar of mayo 10,000 times. That's it. There is literally nothing else to this game. You get some funny costumes for the jar of mayo, and the music is pretty catchy but unless you want to click a jar of mayo 10,000 times then there's really no reason to buy this game. You can get some easy, if not painful achievements so there's that if that's what you're into. The mayo wears some bikinis too. Yeah that's about it. If you want to click mayo, this is the game for you, if you don't want to click mayo then this isn't the game for you. For more reviews follow my [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/40795588/] curator page. [/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198288661505', 'num_games_owned': 407, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1659447864}
review: My Name is Mayo is a simple game, a fun one. All you need to do is click, but you can change the looks of the mayo and have different stories. To 100% you just need to do all the stories of the mayo and then click the jar 10000 times and then you have another completed game on your list.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025472202', 'num_games_owned': 1981, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1628823643}
review: Mayonnaise is the leading cause of heart death in Berlin. Did you know that? I bet you didn't and yet you went and made a game about the stuff. a Tedious game that involves both clicking on and romancing the Mayo and yet not a single mention of the catastrophic health crisis Mayo has caused in the German capital. You spend 0.99 on a jar of Mayo and watch as your organs turn grey and grumpy.

author: {'steamid': '76561198163909832', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1650083006}
review:
This game changed my life. It is my life. Mayo is life.
A rich, deep and compelling story that truly encapsulates the modern and unique struggles that has endured since the mid 20th century. 
We learn much about our protagonist - the humble jar of Mayonnaise, about their journey of finding themselves and their life. 

Worth every cent.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067436243', 'num_games_owned': 961, 'num_reviews': 110, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1649983704}

author: {'steamid': '76561199007683104', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1649174590}
review: There is not really much to dislike about the game. It is extremely easy to get every achievement for this game. So if getting achievements is your thing this is a must get. Especially since it's basically only one dollar! I was able to finish every achievement in 1.1 hours. This game is probably not meant for one sitting since all you do is click. The story side is a little humorous too. Otherwise, you're just clicking a Mayo jar as he goes through a different scenarios about his life. I recommend only if you are an achievement hunter and want easy achievements for almost no cost.

review: Truly the pinnacle of inmersive gameplay, the graphics are beyond any title of it's age and our current age, captivating story with the most jaw dropping revelations known to have ever existed, impressive audio, extremely smooth performance and overall just a masterpiece, if there's any game that can be considered the highest point in human history no doubt it is My Name is Mayo. This is a must play for anyone who wants to call themselves "cultured".

author: {'steamid': '76561198336133631', 'num_games_owned': 180, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1628398937}
review:
It's all right if you have an hour to kill and want a short and silly clicker game to keep you occupied during that time.

It's definitely a one-and-done kind of game, though. Now that Steam has granted me the opportunity to click cookies, I don't see myself ever coming back to click bottles of mayonnaise. (Unless I do decide to pick up the sequel to this game - because of course there is a sequel.)

author: {'steamid': '76561198149222284', 'num_games_owned': 1907, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 202, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1641330237}
review:
I would give this a neutral rating if I could.
The game is what it tells you it is. You just click a jar of mayonnaise. It has a few jokes in it and a lot of random stuff.
If you use the skins when they get available it will take you 10000 clicks to complete the whole game. Just keep clicking the jar, not much else to it. 
I do have to be honest, there are a lot of free clickers that offer a lot more. The game is very short. Once you complete the game you still have to idle a few hours to get all the card drops. 

At least I got to buttonsmash a jar of mayonnaise wearing a leopard bikini while I was at it. Even topless I might add.

author: {'steamid': '76561198978524635', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 133, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1646936996}
review:
Despu√©s de jugar este aut√©ntico JUEGAZO s√≥lo me queda una sensaci√≥n de satisfacci√≥n. En mi an√°lisis subjetivo creo que es un juego que todo jugador debe jugar, si no le asusta un poco de dificultad. Detallar√© para m√≠ los puntos importantes:

Historia:
Es rica y profunda, contada a partir de los NPCs que vas encontrando o detalles del entorno. Cuanto m√°s vas descubriendo el mundo m√°s ves el rico lore que tiene. Personalmente me hubiera gustado una historia contada de manera m√°s clara, pero para el g√©nero que es se va entendiendo bastante bien si est√°s atento.

Jugabilidad:
Controles muy precisos y √°giles. Secciones de plataformas y peleas con bosses DUROS. A medida que avanzas vas ganando poderes para acceder a nuevas √°reas, como en todo metroidvania. Empiezas siendo un bicho peque√±o y con poco rango de movimiento y acabas yendo a la velocidad del rayo saltando por todo el mundo.

Arte, sonido y banda sonora:
El arte y los gr√°ficos son espectaculares, los entornos son diferentes y sientes sensaciones distintas seg√∫n el √°rea, las hay m√°s vivas, m√°s misteriosas, o sobrecogedoras. El sonido y la banda sonora son espectaculares, para un juego como este. No hay grandes piezas orquestales, son peque√±os arreglos de cuerdas o pocos intrumentos, que denotan lo peque√±os que nos sentimos frente al apabullante mundo. En general el arte y la m√∫sica han sido para mi de 10.

Esto es todo, repito, a todo jugador que no le asuste un poco de dificultad y quiera descubrir un mundo maravilloso y aterrador, dentro del g√©nero metroidvania, es un juego que recomiendo 100%.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048865581', 'num_games_owned': 2546, 'num_reviews': 242, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1641049361}
review:
Behind the fancy artstyle is a painfully bad clicker. The game contains 4 "jokes" and to do everything, you'll require a minimum of 10,000 clicks. 

That's it. That's the "Memes". I mean honestly, a comedic clicker game can't have 2500 clicks per joke. Literally lazier than free clickers. 

It's a shame though. Getting pulled along for some terrible jokes that are essentially deadpan "I wanted to be x. I am mayo though XD". 

It's a short game, so that's the only reason I won't refund this. But this seriously is an insanely weak product. One of the only games where I'd say that even the game being free wouldn't really save it from being as much of a sad disappointment that it is.

author: {'steamid': '76561198170185883', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 36, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1640520511}
review:
There are 3 basic rules in this game:

A) If you click on the left mouse button, you follow the regular game mode
B) If you click on the right one, you might be surprised by some extras
C) Follow the order to "unlock them all" and see the final message in the game, with deeper meaning

In addition I may add that I am really curious what MBTI type have creators behind this game. Honesty, despite the click style, all achievements are very unusual, interesting and funny at the same time. In such a simple game, managing to do that is almost insane (in positive sense).

I bought this, because didn't had any eggs with mayo in December this year >>>> Ended up with a smile on my face. Worth any penny.

author: {'steamid': '76561198994064783', 'num_games_owned': 1174, 'num_reviews': 261, 'playtime_forever': 246, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 246, 'last_played': 1637201125}
review:
Guten Tag meine Lieben,

da ich Mayo schon immer Ketchup vorgezogen habe kam ich nat√ºrlich nicht umhin, dieses Prachtexemplar von Game auszuprobieren.

Es ist nat√ºrlich im klassischen Sinne ein Clickergame wie man es kennt.

Allerdings mit integriertem Achievementsystem, wodurch du deiner Mayo diverse Outfits freiklickern und anziehen kannst um dann in diesen Outfits wiederum andere Outfits freizuklickern.

Sehr s√º√ü gemacht und eine sehr nette Besch√§ftigung f√ºr nebenbei.

Wenn man nicht mit einem Autoclicker spielt, auch durchaus was f√ºr einige Stunden, da man insgesamt mindestens 10.000 mal klicken muss um alle Achievements freizuspielen.

Bei den Outfits haben die Entwickler sich auch einiges lustiges einfallen lassen, sodass es f√ºr diesen Preis definitiv den Spa√ü wert ist!

Lg SyS

author: {'steamid': '76561198081998768', 'num_games_owned': 414, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1636497557}
review: Only played this game for an hour but it's worth it. Some of you may play even quicker if you catch on fast enough. This game is well designed with a lot of the achievements in mind. Incorporating a lot into the achievement system makes a game as simple as this (where all you do is click, click, click) worth clicking for. I find games like this really help me setup for small goals and achievements while putting patience into practice. What really peaked my interest in the game though was the art style. It's beautiful. I love art work like this since it really throws you back and sticks out more than our pixel and CGI concept games. This was super fun and simply enjoyable. The stories aren't much to look forward to, but they're only for achievements, so passable. Definitely recommend this for anyone into a minimal (and quick) type of clicking game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197971175183', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 140, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1636072096}
review:
50 free steam achievements with a auto-clicker or macro and 30mins tops of your time.

[In English] - Translation to help my foreign friends understand

[h1] Mayonnaise in a glass bottle?[/h1]

I got all the achievements and finished the game, 
but the sound of the mayonnaise glass beating still lingers in my ears.

In fact, it was the first time I'd ever seen mayonnaise in a glass bottle. 
Beating the mayonnaise bottle a clicker game, but since it requires at least 10,000 clicks, 
it is recommended to turn off the sound effect.

[b]The number of clicks achievement requires at least 10,000 clicks, 
and there is a separate achievement for each story. 
Of course, even that can be obtained by clicking on it.[/b]

It's less than a dollar from the list price, and it's 50 achievements. 
It's hard to find a game like this for achievement hunters. 
I highly recommend it because I love achievements.

C√≥mo hacer Fideos con salsa de tomate:
1
Para empezar con la preparaci√≥n de los fideos con tomate, coge una olla y pon el agua a hervir. Cuando alcance el punto de ebullici√≥n, incorpora la pasta y una cucharadita de sal. Coc√≠nala hasta que est√© al dente y revu√©lvela con frecuencia con una cuchara de madera.

2
Mientras se cuecen los fideos, corta las salchichas en c√≠rculos finos y la cebolla a rodajas. Ahora coge una sart√©n y fr√≠e los dos ingredientes juntos. Cuando est√©n hechos, baja el fuego y a√±ade la salsa de tomate y el or√©gano al gusto. Deja que se cocine el sofrito movi√©ndolo de vez en cuando durante unos minutos, luego ret√≠ralo del fuego.

Receta de Fideos con salsa de tomate - Paso 2Imagen: recetas-azucena.com
3
Mientras se hace el sofrito de los fideos, a√±ade las alverjas a la pasta. Cuando est√©n cocidos los fideos esc√∫rrelos junto con las alverjas y p√°sales un poco de agua fr√≠a.

Ahora que ya tienes todos los ingredientes cocinados, ya puedes servir los platos. Para ello, coloca los fideos y sobre ellos un poco de salsa de tomate con cebolla y salchicha. Como ves, se trata de una receta de pasta con tomate muy sencilla, r√°pida y que gustar√° a todos. Si lo deseas, puedes acompa√±ar este rico plato con una ensalada fresca.

author: {'steamid': '76561198354336205', 'num_games_owned': 171, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1624906780}
review:
Well, What can i say about this game, Your goal is to get a consecutive amount of Clicks on the Mayo Jar to 10,000 clicks. As you are trying to reach this milestone, you have other prerequisite to which you need to obtain, there are stories and a certain amount of clicks to get to the next achievement as you continue to yourself to 10,000 clicks, Very Simple, Yes.

This game itself is quite short and i honestly only play this game as the (Steam) achievements itself are really easy to obtain, based on my time I've played this game and me receiving all of the (Steam) achievements.

[i]I did it again didn't i? Gosh darn it[/i]

review:
This is the best idea for an achievement clicker I have seen. Loved the fifties artwork style, the memes as you play through the story and level up, the upbeat theme tune that keeps you smiling (even if it is a little 
repetitive). I liked that the achievements register on your Steam profile. The badges, birds mini-game and related content were also a nice touch.

review:
What can I say.....

I just clicked for almost 4 hours on a glass of mayo that keeps popping up in absurd costumes. As incredibly stupid as this gameplay sounds, you also feel like this in the meantime. Strangely enough, if you get involved, it's kind of fun.

I would definitely spent 99 cents on more pointless things.

review: My Name is Mayo is a funny gimmick clicker-game by Green Lava Studios. For $0.99 USD, I was gifted this game as a joke; it takes about an hour to complete the game and obtain all 50 achievements. There isn't any progress to be made after achieving 10,000 clicks (which is the last progress-based achievement).

review: You keep clicking the mayonnaise. You can click on the achievements to get more achievements and see the mayo jar dressed in all kinds of outfits. author: {'steamid': '76561198039989738', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 25, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 25, 'last_played': 1609323878}
review:
[hr][/hr]
[h1]My Name is Mayo[/h1]
[i]My name is Mayo is a clicking adventure where you click a jar of Mayo in order to discover different story paths told through achievements. The game features 4 different story paths which along with all the achievements can be completed within 30 - 45 mins depending on how fast you can click your mouse.[/i]

[h1]Would I recommend My Name is Mayo?[/h1]
[i]I'm not sure, depends on what you're looking for. If all you're looking for is to 100% a game then sure, My Name is Mayo is for you. But if you're looking for something like Cookie Clicker, AdVenture Capitalist or Clicker Heroes then no, this isn't for you.[/i]

[h1]TLDR;[/h1]
[i]Although fairly short My Name is Mayo offers a fun one time experience, which can be 100%'d in a matter of 10.000 clicks.[/i]

[b]EDIT:[/b] Download an auto clicker, save your fingers.

[hr][/hr]

Este jogo te faz refletir sobre muitos aspectos do quotidiano, colocando-lhe no papel de [strike]Doug Funnie[/strike] algu√©m que abusa de um pote de maionese usando apenas o dedo indicador. Mas n√£o um pote de maionese comum, mas sim com consci√™ncia de vida, onde a medida que voc√™ toca no pote ela fala fatos curiosos sobre eventos aleat√≥rios. Com alguns cliques voc√™ libera algumas fantasias, digamos, sensuais para seu pote de maionese, voc√™ sempre ir√° liberar novas fantasias a medida que for clicando.

Em um piscar de olhos, voc√™ j√° ter√° feito metade das conquistas, aproximadamente 5000 cliques para isso, os outros 5000 cliques necess√°rios para obter todas as conquistas do jogo, ter√£o que serem obtidos praticamente sem motiva√ß√£o alguma que n√£o essa √∫ltima conquista. O jogo √© graficamente inspirado no estilo dos anos '50, com arte agrad√°vel, falas brilhantes e fantasias c√¥micas. Platinei em 68 minutos, parando algumas vezes para n√£o cansar o pulso.

author: {'steamid': '76561198035655574', 'num_games_owned': 1323, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 159, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 159, 'last_played': 1594332323}
review:
If you are looking for a fairly easy to 100% game then this is a lighthearted clicker which will only take a few hours to complete but takes patience towards the end.

If you are hoping for an offline accumulative type clicker or a game with something that resembles gameplay then this isn't it to be honest.

It's quite quirky, and it looked like something in good humour from the store page so I bought it without much of a second look while it was on sale (it's pretty cheap as it is to be honest). There are elements of humour here but it probably isn't as amusing as I thought it might be.

Either way it's not too bad for something to pass the time with or to do in the background while listening to music or something.

author: {'steamid': '76561198019487666', 'num_games_owned': 845, 'num_reviews': 93, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1593658388}
review:
I got this for sale (75c AUD) is it worth the full price...hmmm maybe not but its up to you depending how rich or pov you are.

So the game is simple, you click away, get achievements and then click on something and get more repeat.
3 different hands (one's just a finger) to pick from, a mini fly mini game also. 50 achievements that mostly anyone can get (if not everyone) as well as some Steam trading cards for your trouble.

TLDR: Cheap game with impossible to not get achievements and steam cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042528828', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1593180081}
review:
I think for the price, this game is worth it, especially on sale. Any higher and I wouldn't recommend it.

Pro 1: The humour (the main reason to buy this game) it got me chuckling quite a few times.
Pro 2: It's a VERY easy full achievement game.
Pro 3: The graphics are nothing special, but fitting to the game, they're pleasant to look at. You can change what your clicker hand looks like.
Pro 4: Facts!

Pro/Con: The sounds are fitting to the game and sound well produced. The tapping will get at you after a while.
Pro/Con: Simple controls. It's a clicker, that's it. I don't think anyone would judge you for using a little 'help' so to speak. 

There is a hidden mini game which adds a little bit more content.

author: {'steamid': '76561199048924113', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1590457798}
review:
Dear Whoever is reading this,

You NEED this game! Just buy it and I promise that you won't regret it. After clicking a mayonnaise jar over 10,000 times for almost an hour, I discovered my true calling in life and became inspired to follow my dreams. It's more than just clicking a jar of mayonnaise wearing a scantily clad bikini, you'll tear up at the game's rich plot and the inspiring life stories of this jar of mayonnaise as well as learn that a group of crows is called a murder. This game changed my life and it's the best ¬£0.79 I've ever spent. 

P.S Jacksepticeye sent me. ;)

review:
My name is Mayo is an awkward achievement clicker game about clicking a Mayonnaise jar 10000 times with 3 kind of fingers, and other than that, i can't possibly imagine why or how it exist.

It has a full playthrough time of 40 minutes for 50 achievements, with an absolute '0' replayability and it's recommended for everyone - even on full price- with an IQ below 80.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093295366', 'num_games_owned': 1198, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1527390880}
review:
[b] Ingredients: [/b]
1 egg yolk
1/2 teaspoon fine salt
1/2 teaspoon dried mustard
2 pinches sugar
2 teaspoons fresh-squeezed lemon juice
1 tablespoon white wine vinegar
1 cup oil (safflower or corn)

[b] Directions: [/b]

[u] Step 1: [/u] In a glass bowl, whisk together egg yolk and dry ingredients. Combine lemon juice and vinegar in a separate bowl then thoroughly whisk half into the yolk mixture. Start whisking briskly, then start adding the oil a few drops at a time until the liquid seems to thicken and lighten a bit, (which means you've got an emulsion on your hands). Once you reach that point you can relax your arm a little (but just a little) and increase the oil flow to a constant (albeit thin) stream. Once half of the oil is in add the rest of the lemon juice mixture.

[u] Step 2: [/u] Continue whisking until all of the oil is incorporated. Leave at room temperature for 1 to 2 hours then refrigerate for up to 1 week.

review: My Name is Mayo is best described as a simulation where you interact with a single jar of (obviously) Mayo and you get to learn all of the different facts of it. The game's description also says that if you are looking for any next generation gameplay and an open world environment then this is not that game. You just simply tap on the jar of Mayo with a single press of a button and doing this a couple of times will unlock something like a trophy for tapping on it as well as some trivia about Mayo and also a costume that you can dress the jar up with. That's right you can dress it up in plenty of comedic ways like giving it a moustache, giving it a guitar, giving it hair or putting it on a Banana Suit and so on and it's slightly amusing to see how the different outfits look on the jar. Tapping on it while it's dressed up in something funny or amusing will give you quick easy 100% . You do get pieces of random trivia about Mayo as well and some of the stuff about the Mayo is rather amusing enough. Summary not really a game

author: {'steamid': '76561198051605733', 'num_games_owned': 489, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1577013711}
review:
M√™me en prenant My Name Is Mayo pour ce qu'il est, c'est √† dire un "clicking game tr√®s minimaliste mais avec des blagues", le r√©sultat est plut√¥t mauvais. Notez que j'ai dit clicking game et non pas idle game d'ailleurs :)

L'id√©e de base est pas d√©goutante non plus : j'ai un petit bout d'une histoire, je clique clique X fois, j'ai la suite de l'histoire, r√©p√©ter sur trois histoires parall√®les. L'humour et les illustrations sont plut√¥t pas mauvais.
Mais h√©las : une fois qu'on a fait le tour de ce que le jeu avait dans le bocal (!), il reste encore environ 7000 clics √† donner , avec allez, un petit succ√®s aux 5000, 7000 et 10000 clics. Du coup c'est tr√®s vide. 

J'ai abandonn√© et j'ai pris un autoclicker pour tout de m√™me conna√Ætre le secret bien gard√© du pot de mayo aux 10000 clics. 
Ben il ne vaut ni votre temps, ni vos 0,99‚Ç¨.

author: {'steamid': '76561198263094175', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 99, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1560365301}
review:
It's a simple clicker game. At first, I didn't realize that I could change the Mayo's outfit anytime in order to unlock some achievements. You only need to click that box on the upper left corner to browse for new achievements. Basically, I wasted 5,000 clicks. To make things worse, I didn't realize it's easier to just use the touchpad. And no, I'm not talking about the left click in the touchpad, but the pad itself. A simple touch means one click.

This is only recommended to those who want to attain 100% achievement in a game. Even when I wasted 5,000 clicks, I managed to play this game in exactly 60 mins. Excess time was used to farm cards from drops.

author: {'steamid': '76561198169389371', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 48, 'playtime_forever': 52, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1518577015}
review:
For Fun: 7/10
For Completing: 9/10

The game is an interesting clicker game that has Mayo as the main object to click the whole time. You switch between stories the more you click with the stories clothing active, and to be honest the stories aren't bad. The only negative thing I could say is that it requires a lot of clicking and gets old real fast and tests the capability of any mouse. For about $1, its definitely not the worst place to spend your money especially if completing the game.

This is one of the easiest games to complete and doesn't take that long at all to ether. I highly recommend picking it up to complete since that's almost 50 free easy achievements that takes 1-2 hours to fully complete.

author: {'steamid': '76561198909040429', 'num_games_owned': 529, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1562267139}
review: So I don't know how to put this so call me a masochist of a sort: I had already played this game and platinumed it on PS4 so why was it that I decided to get this game again but this time on Steam? I don't have a clue, I guess it's because 1. It's a slightly popular game 2. all achievements can be achieved in at least 20 minutes 3. At least something special happens at the end despite it being dumb and short. 4. I could honestly see a bit of the humor in this game enough to sort of like it. So what do I say about this game after playing it again? Is it stupid? Yes it is very stupid, but for the right reasons. Is it short? Why yes, it's very short and you'll earn all the achievements in about 20 minutes? Is it considered pointless? Believe it or not, I actually don't think this is at all a pointless game because it provides a good logical sense of humor and it gives you a bit of a lovely piece of advice at the end when you complete the game 100% which is enough to satisfy me. I say play this game if you need a bit of caffeine in your gaming library and your life

author: {'steamid': '76561198190380543', 'num_games_owned': 613, 'num_reviews': 603, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1557049762}
review: A simple, cheap clicker in which you continuously tap on a jar of mayonnaise for some easy achievements. As you click along, you unlock new costumes for the jar, telling a few stories about it. But I liked this little time waster.

author: {'steamid': '76561198864422585', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 79, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1629152973}
review: This game has allowed me to transcend dimensions. I have discovered the secrets of the universe. I have learned that there truly is a god, and its name is Mayo. I may not enjoy eating Mayo, but I still worship it like all of my other brethren. I ask that you too purchase this game and experience it's majesty, it's beauty, and learn of the story it has to tell. There are three stories, one that will teach the worry of someone trying to impress, that has lost themselves in their delusion; another that will teach you of growth and strength, the never ending urge to feel different and special; then lastly, one of love, where the Mayo tells a story of love that ended due to superficial events, and not to let these failures get to you, and to move on. I lied, as there is one final story, that teaches us of life, and although it is short, it has the biggest impact, telling us why we move, what we are, and how we live. Don't forget either the knowledge this game shares with its players, milestones for reaching heights many perceive as pointless or stupid, but how else will you open the jar, and discover the true hidden meaning. You may wonder, what is this true meaning, this overwhelming knowledge that you speak? You must open the jar for yourself, and discover it on your own...

author: {'steamid': '76561198043609914', 'num_games_owned': 3556, 'num_reviews': 834, 'playtime_forever': 78, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 78, 'last_played': 1498480637}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a clicker game where you click on a jar of mayo. As there's no story we are jumping straight into graphics.

Graphics:

The graphics are alright. Art style is rather simplistic and I mean there's nothing complex as all there is a jar of mayo on the screen, with different skins and the hand icon you move around to click on the jar of mayo. There's nothing special about the art style, but overall there's nothing incredibly bad.

Audio:

The music is really forgettable and not good at all, not to mention spamming the jar makes this annoying clicking noise that sounds like a finger tapping on glass. It was so bad that after 10 minutes of playing, I muted the game and just put on my own music while I attempted to get the achievements.

Gameplay:

If you played a clicker game, this is literally the same thing, just even more bland and boring. All you do is click the mayo jar. You can put on different skins, but that doesn't really change anything. The game is incredibly boring and feels like a free to play flash game.  Nothing about this game is fun, it's rather boring.

Verdict:

There's not a lot I can say about this title. If you want a clicker game why not just play Adventure Capitalist or Clicker Heroes, they are really fleshed out clicker games and not to mention they are both free while this one costs money.

Final Rating:
1/10

Pros:
N/A

Cons:
- Boring
- All you do is click without any reason
- Costs money

If you liked this review please consider joining https://steamcommunity.com/groups/completingthebacklog and https://steamcommunity.com/groups/ImperialReviews

author: {'steamid': '76561198281976220', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 136, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 136, 'last_played': 1503141547}
review:
[h1]My Name is Mayo[/h1]
My Name is Mayo is an... interesting game to say the least. I honestly didn't know what to expect with this game, however once i started playing i quickly started to enjoyed the weird humor it had to offer.

[b]Pros[/b]
+ It's suprisingly funny (and not in the so bad it's good kind of way either)
+ The controls are super easy (all you do is click a jar of mayonnaise)
+ It's quite short, which is a good thing for a game like this

[b]Cons[/b]
- It's a bit too pricey for what you get, and to be honest, it should be free in my opinion (i suppose the steam cards you get somewhat make up for that)
- Gets a bit repedative near the end (to get the last acheivments, you have to click for a very long time)
- Once you get all the achievments, it has no replay value

Although My Name is Mayo is a decent/funny clicker game, unless you have money to splurge on cheap games, are into weird meme games, or want a cheap joke gift for a friend, you should probably buy something else.

author: {'steamid': '76561198244387248', 'num_games_owned': 549, 'num_reviews': 47, 'playtime_forever': 101, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 101, 'last_played': 1533689250}
review:
This game is really just a clicker game but it's done in an interesting way.  You discover little stories and some trivia through your active clicking, which makes it fun to play.  There's also a "secret" (?) shooter game where you fly around as a little cupcake kinda guy and shoot the evil flies who are coming to eat you~!  You get to this mini-game by right clicking on your mouse, which also lets you choose between one of three unique clicker hands/fingers (which I found a pleasant surprise).  

So yes, this game was overall surprisingly fun and involved!  I recommend it to anyone interested in clicker games and maybe people who are just interested in trying new things.

author: {'steamid': '76561198059673134', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1530018346}
review:
I unlocked 94% of the achievements in 25 minutes.

The gameplay is nothing but a mayonnaise jar, occasionally dressed like other things.

I clicked 8000 times.

You can right-click for the most basic of arcade-style shooters (think: Asteroid) for no reward or purpose.

I saw a lets-play of this game beforehand, and am still disappointed.

I do not 'diss' the creators of this game, because of ALL the "clicker" games there are, this is one of the most polished ones. Achievements, good art, and fleshed-out (if not repetetive) music. It counts your clicks. There's not much else to this game.

The reason I give this a negative review is because, let's be honest, this should've been a free (maybe-even-flash) game. 

I have no issue paying developers for their work. An animation of a jiggling jar accompanied by a "clink" sound, some music on loop, a cursor that "taps" the jar when you click, and ~20 minutes of gamplay, is NOT worth a Dollar. Even cookie clicker had more than that.

Would rather go get something off the Dollar menu at McDonalds. At least I'd it'd last a few hours before I shat it out, unlike this game.

EDIT: Also, don't act like I'm not "getting the joke" with this game. I got the joke. It's a good parody. For the first 10-ish minutes. Then my finger got tired and I found that I was wasting an additional 10 minutes of my life for nothing. 

Love ya, devs, for giving it an honest-good try to put your game into the "Clicker" fad of gaming.. but the fad is over and your game costs a dollar. I WILL be seeking a refund.

review:
G√©nial quand on a la collectionnite et qu'on aime cliquer en rafale juste pour cliquer, comme √ßa !
C'est un clicker game qui a du go√ªt ^^

Les succ√®s d√©bloqu√©s permettent de suivre le fil de 3 petites histoires diff√©rentes, le tout parsem√© de "fun facts", c'est tr√®s plaisant et amusant.

Bien s√ªr, on peut se demander si cela vaut la peine de payer m√™me quelques centimes pour un jeu aussi simpliste et vite fini... 

Personnellement j'estime que oui : le prix n'est pas excessif et loin d'√™tre au-dessus de ses ambitions somme toute tr√®s humbles, et malgr√© tout, c'est un concept, il y a un peu + que juste du clic √† la pelle sans aucune motivation et il y a de l'id√©e et du boulot derri√®re, et je ne parle m√™me pas des graphismes d√©licieusement vintage !

Aucun regret pour moi :D

review:
<<My Name is Mayo>>

Ich liebe Mini-Spiele & verr√ºckte Dinge. "My Name is Mayo" kombiniert beides.

Spielablauf:
Im Endeffekt muss man nur mit der Maus klicken & wenn man eine neue Errungenschaft frei geschaltet hat dort drauf klicken & so bekommt die Mayo ein neues Outfit. Bei 10 000Klicks & allen Errungenschaften ist das Spiel vorbei.
Nach ca. 1h ist das Mini-Spiel geschafft.

Die Grafik:
Sie ist s√º√ü gemacht, gef√§llt mir f√ºr den Preis super !! Erst recht diese ulkigen Outfits :D
Kleiner Spoiler: *deine Mayo bekommt ein Leoparden-Bikini* ‚ô•


Mein Fazit:
S√º√ü gemacht, witzige Idee, aber nach ca 6.000 Klicks tat mir die Hand weh & es hat sich hingezogen. Die Mayo-Outfits machen es aber wieder gut.
F√ºr jemanden, der Errungenschaften & "Perfekte Spiele" f√ºr sein Profil sammelt eine Super M√∂glichkeit, aber auch klasse f√ºr den langeweilevertreib.

4 von 5 Herzen‚ô•

XOXO Madame Citron

review: The game is a meme. It tried way to hard to be funny, and has no substance. You can't disable sounds, only the music. The minigame is annoying to play and to hear. The entire game is about a jar of Mayo, and there is no progression, only skins for the jar. Trying to start the game or tabbing out causes the game to be temporarily unplayable while I try to get it to respond. I only have as much time in the game as I do because I wanted the achievements. I regret ever touching this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198092169097', 'num_games_owned': 908, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 74, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 74, 'last_played': 1519604785}
review:
[h1] Das Ultimative Spiel f√ºr Mayo Liebhaber! [/h1]

Als gro√üer Mayo Fan und K√§mpfer an der vordersten Front gegen diese Ketchup Menschen, war dieses Spiel nat√ºrlich ein [b][u]absoluter Pflichtkauf[/u][/b] f√ºr mich! Und ich muss sagen, ich wurde zu keinster Zeit auch nur im geringsten Entt√§uscht. 

Die Art und Weise, wie die Mayonnaise hier dargestellt wird im Zusammenspiel mit der Musik und dem klicken der Maus, haben mich besonders angesprochen. Die Story hinter dem Spiel ist auch sehr gut geschrieben, wobei man nat√ºrlich sagen muss, dass eine Story √ºber Mayonnaise auch einfach nicht schlecht werden kann! 

Nach ungef√§hr einer Stunde hatte ich das Spiel dann mit allen Errungenschaften durchgespielt und auch wenn ich noch Stunden weiterspielen h√§tte k√∂nnen, f√ºhle ich mich dem Endsieg √ºber die Ketchupisten schon deutlich n√§her und [b]DAF√úR[/b] m√∂chte ich mich bei den Entwicklern einfach nochmal mit einem gro√üen [b]Dankesch√∂n[/b] bedanken!


[h1]F√ºr immer Mayo und nat√ºrlich NIEDER mit den Ketchup Frevlern meine Freunde![/h1]

review:
Esse √© um jogo no estilo clicker que voc√™ precisa simplesmente clicar no vidro de maionese. A diferen√ßa para esse jogo √© que possui uma hist√≥ria que amarra as "miss√µes" e os achievements. 

Quando come√ßar o jogo voc√™ deve, ap√≥s os primeiros cliques e achievements, clicar no menu superior √† esquerda e selecionar uma "miss√£o". Dentro de cada miss√£o voc√™ ir√° atingir outros achievements com quantidade de cliques entre 10 e 500, sendo em m√©dia 100 cliques.

author: {'steamid': '76561198327367911', 'num_games_owned': 710, 'num_reviews': 97, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1514929204}
review:
Wonderfully whipped! Probably the most caucasian game ever, lol. It's a simple mouse clicker, with some hillarious insites and stories on sex, growing up and just about everything in life really.

Pros - simple and easy game play, great for casual gamers, cheap, hillarious and interesting random facts
Cons - short

A little, guilty pleasure game this, since you don't really want to be telling your AAA shooter clan buddies you were getting a kick from playing with mayo... Lol, still wort it thuough. Have a potato. 8/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198193589490', 'num_games_owned': 676, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 123, 'last_played': 1511486700}
review:
Ohje wieder eines dieser [i]Clicker-Spiele[/i]
Aber dieses ist anders. Ich habe schon hochpreisige RPGs gespielt, wo der Protagonist nicht mal ann√§hernd so viel Charme hat wie dieses Glas Mayonnaise! 

Man klickt sich durch 4 verschiedene Storylines, bzw. begleitet die Mayonnaise durch ein paar Lebensabschnitte

Abgesehen von verschiedenen Hintergr√ºnden und Kost√ºmen f√ºr die Mayonese, wird man zwischendruch sogar noch mit Random Facts belohnt. (Richtigkeit ohne Gew√§hr)
Besonders die Retroaufmachung und der trockene Humor haben mich angesprochen und ziehen sich komplett durch das Spiel, Abzeichen, Hintergr√ºnde & Emoticons.

Kaufempfehlung wenn es runtergesetzt ist <3 Habe es f√ºr 74Cent erworben.

[spoiler]"I will tell you something important about life. Life is like a box of chocolates. Just kidding, who compares life with a box of chocolates?"[/spoiler]

author: {'steamid': '76561198114554013', 'num_games_owned': 248, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 118, 'last_played': 1604050910}
review:
[h1] tl;dr [/h1]
[u][b]obra maestra.[/b][/u]

Era una noche oscura, los cigarrillos y el caf√© no eran suficiente.
Quer√≠a jugar; quer√≠a alejarme de la sucia realidad que conlleva estar vivo.

De pronto, algo salt√≥ en mi pantalla.
Hab√≠a recibido un regalo, y me dije a mi mismo:
-¬øes...? NO. No puede ser posible.

Pero lo era.
El juego hab√≠a cruzado el escenario greenlight.
Me sent√≠ sucio por no haberme enterado antes.

Habr√° tomado cuatro, tal vez seis segundos para instalarse.
Jam√°s hab√≠a estado tan ansioso.

Lo que sent√≠ al tenerlo en mi biblioteca, y verlo instalado...
el poder hacer click en "Jugar"...  simplemente magnif√≠co.
Es una sensaci√≥n indescriptible.

No quiero hacer spoilers sobre esta obra maestra, pero creo que merece totalmente la pena adquirirlo, con o sin rebajas de steam.

Mi vida jam√°s volver√° a ser igual.
La mayonesa me ha demostrado el verdadero significado de la vida.
Ahora entiendo qu√© es el amor.

Entender todo esto es complicado, pero deber√°s experimentarlo; y as√≠... comprender.

Nuestro lenguaje no ha evolucionado lo suficiente para poder transmitir lo que este juego te hace sentir.
He grabado mi traves√≠a a trav√©s de su campa√±a tan inmersiva.

Esto quedar√° como mi legado para futuras generaciones; especialmente para mi descendencia.

He ascendido.

PERO ESTO NO ACABA AQU√ç.

Para alcanzar mi verdadera forma, debo dedicarme a conseguir mi insignia nivel 5 y como bonus; la reflectante.
(Espero est√©n disponibles).

author: {'steamid': '76561198014833158', 'num_games_owned': 965, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 40, 'last_played': 1492423267}
review:
[h1] Normal Review![/h1]

I bought this game because a buddy of mine said it was an easy achievement game, and it is. But we'll leave that for the Achievement Review after this. 

You're not getting much here, honestly. It's a clicker. [i]BUT[/i] It's a quarky clicker. You click the jar of mayo and it preogresses little short stories depending on which one you have selected at the time, each stsory also has a related costume for the jar of mayo. 

[h1] Achievement Review![/h1]
Just click! That's all this game has to offer in terms of gameplay. You can honestly just download a clicker and do it that was pretty quickly, which I reccomend because you don't want to break your mouse, now, do you?

author: {'steamid': '76561198117837119', 'num_games_owned': 3902, 'num_reviews': 178, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1472609874}
review:
If you don't mind idle clickers, definitely consider picking this one up. Otherwise, I advise you not to get this.

I really like this game! It's funny and has multiple "story lines" for your mayonaise jar. Many of the achievements have different costumes for your mayonaise jar to wear, which are funny to see.

After you complete all of the achievements and get all of the costumes, that's about it.

I'm sorry My Name is Mayo, it's been fun while it lasted.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064139415', 'num_games_owned': 777, 'num_reviews': 411, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1623142819}
review:
Empfehlenswert: Nein (pers√∂nliche Wertung: 1/10)

Errungenschaften: Ja (Stumpfheit siegt)

Positiv:
- simples Spielprinzip

Negativ:
- stumpfes Gameplay, welches Ausdauer ben√∂tigt

Fazit:
My Name is Mayo ist ein Spiel, welches f√ºr Achievementj√§ger gemacht ist. Gefunden habe ich es in einem Beitrag auf Facebook, in dem das Spiel als leichte Platintroph√§e geworben wurde. Es ist nicht allzu schwer die Steuerung zu verinnerlichen. F√ºr diejenigen die da Schwierigkeiten haben: Klicke auf das Glas! Mehr aber auch nicht! Sobald die ersten Erfolge freigeschaltet wurden, kann man das Mayonaiseglas nach belieben anziehen und sogenannte "Storylines" verfolgen, was einen noch mehr Erfolge einbringt! Eins muss ich dazu noch sagen... Man braucht Ausdauer! H√§tte ich nicht einen Laptop mit Touchpad, w√§re ich durch das Klicken der Maus Wahnsinng geworden. Die 10000 Klicks erreichen sich n√§mlich nicht von alleine! Nach 48 Minuten war ich durch und hatte die 100% erf√ºllt. Schaltet euch den Fernseher an, wenn ihr diese stupide Erfahrung machen wollt, sonst verkalkt ihr noch. Empfehlenswert f√ºr Achievementj√§ger ohne Sehnenscheidenentz√ºndung, jedoch dar√ºber hinaus nicht zu empfehlen!!!!

review:
10000 Klicks auf eine Mayo Flasche (der man gezwungenerma√üen u.a. einen Bikini √ºberziehen muss) um es durchzuspielen. Starke Leistung Green Lava Studios.

Ganz ehrlich: Ich finde es nicht in Ordnung wenn Leute Spiele positiv auf Steam bewerten blo√ü weil man auf die schnelle 50 Erfolge farmen kann. Das ist einfach nicht korrekt. Soll jeder selbst wissen ob er unbedingt 99 Cent ausgeben muss um seine virtuellen Zahlen im Profil zu erh√∂hen, aber deswegen ist es trotzdem ein M√ºllhaufen von einem Spiel und geh√∂rt negativ bewertet, Ende der Durchsage.

author: {'steamid': '76561198130516505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 324, 'playtime_forever': 84, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 84, 'last_played': 1501556172}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a narrative clicker in which you click a jar to progress and unlock interesting dialogue and story paths.

Pros:
-Interesting and sometimes hilarious dialogue and visual jokes, considering that you are literally just clicking on a jar of mayo
-It has trading cards and Steam Achievements
-The game knows how to pace itself, and in my opinion is a clicker done right. Running an autoclicker you can complete the game with all achievements within about an hour, but you'd rather want to click away and read the amazing dialogue that appears after every set amount of clicks
-Simplistic design and user interface is appealing, and provides easy to navigate and better overall experience

Cons:
-You going to have to click a whole lot. Possible finger cramps may arise

Overall, this is an awesome, short clicker. Perfect as an interesting time waster
7/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198385501958', 'num_games_owned': 26, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 34, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 34, 'last_played': 1503581839}
review:
From Green Lava Studios comes My Name is Mayo, a clicker game with a difference. Only costing ¬£0.79 on Steam, I decided to give this a try, knowing that there was a story behind the whole thing. 

There isn‚Äôt much behind this game other than the constant clicking of a mayonnaise jar, and it didn‚Äôt seem that promising. However, Green Lava Studios have gone beyond with numerous stories, unlocked by continuing to click on the mayonnaise jar. The stories themselves are absolutely hilarious, and the skins you unlock on the mayonnaise jar by progressing through the story and hysterical; I fell off my chair laughing at one point. 

Highly repetitive, but with under an hour competition time, and enough entertainment to keep you chuckling, this is a good spend of 79 pence. I really don‚Äôt regret buying this game, and I‚Äôll definitely be playing it more than once.

author: {'steamid': '76561198138230812', 'num_games_owned': 1959, 'num_reviews': 201, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 50, 'last_played': 1501743407}
review: Suitable for achievement hunters. Your goal is to reach 10 thousand hits with your mouse and do 46 different tasks while progressing. It's kinda humoristic. I liked this game and I can really recommend it to others. It comes with 50 Achievements that takes less then 1 hour to get and Steam Trading Cards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198082808136', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 338, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 338, 'last_played': 1466748774}
review:
I'm not sure why I bought this. It's got meme factor, but it's kind of regrettable. You just end up realizing the jokes are kind of stale, but to make it worth your money you find an autoclicker program online to quickly get all the achievements. You close the game out, uninstall it, and never play it again.

My Name is Mayo is really tasteless, no pun intended. (Or is it?)

author: {'steamid': '76561198046636147', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 160, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1498994758}
review:
A short little game that shows a lot of humor and lets you work out your finger muscles more than your average clicker game. If all that clicking is starting to kill your mouse, you can use the space button to double your output :) 

That being said, I bought it during the Summer sale when it cost less than a Euro. This price seems reasonable to me, even though there are many free games on the web that give you more fun for free. 

So what I'm trying to say is, if this game is ALMOST free than you should buy it. Just remember, this is more of a distraction than an experience.

author: {'steamid': '76561198225073792', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1498190621}
review:
The good:
Cute aesthetic 
A couple cute-ish story lines 

The bad:
Extremely repetetive soundtrack with obnoxious mayo sound
No volume controls (or any other controls)
While the story lines are cute, they are WAY too short
The game itself is too short--spent an hour on it with breaks and completed all 50 achievements

The... meh...?
If you are looking for a clicker, strictly a clicker, this game may be for you.  There are NO upgrades, NO buffs, NOTHING to make clicking go faster.  Also, while you're clicking, you're never told what you're clicking for.  There's nothing listed next to the ever-increasing number on the top of the screen.  I assume that the clicks are literally taps on the side of the mayo jar... I guess it's supposed to be cute?  
The story, while artistically attractive, is far too short and doesn't make much sense.
There are only four screens in the whole game, two of which are different leader boards.

This seems to be a clicker made by some developers that heard clickers were really big right now and never actually played a clicker.  Especially as the game forces you to move your pointer as your clicking if you want to have your clicks count.  Even at only an hour in, I feel like I'm getting carpal tunnel.

There are literally hundreds of free clicker games that are better crafted, smarter, and less agrivating than My Name is Mayo out there.

tl;dr - This is a repetetive, short click-fest.  Just go out and play Cookie Clicker if you're looking for a fun clicker game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198079167614', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1498071586}
review:
Wow, i've barely even played this game, and already its amazing!
The game starts with just a normal mayo jar, but you soon realise something is amiss.
The storyline of this game is just amazing, you will have an experiance like no other.
Sure the game has some tedious parts, but when you get through it, my god its amazing.
You have to play this game to truly experiance what this game has to offer, and its so cheap
its a literal bargain for the hours of fun that are sure to come out of this game.
Love is true, Love is life, Love....is....mayo...

author: {'steamid': '76561198027267313', 'num_games_owned': 1838, 'num_reviews': 4460, 'playtime_forever': 1651, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1651, 'last_played': 1497742647}
review:
Tags: Clicker - Fast
Additional Tags: Delete Local Content & Remove from Library

TLDR: Rather competently put together but no gameplay to speak of. Would damage your mouse to 100%. Quota spamclick game.

Presentation with fifties-style audiovisuals, a few different trees of unlockables that you can pursue by clicking further and activating the newest unlocked button to continue that specific sub-category of achievements further. Most of them are simple one line of dialogue and one icon. Activating them for further development will sometimes cosmetically alter the pot of mayo with a mustache, a rain of cats, or other such nonsense. That is basically the crux of the game. Because of the repetitive mindless nature of the game, the lack of real gameplay, and the meaningless nature of the unlocks I am going to simply remove this for declutter altogther. However this game does make me curious about their newer title Mr Massagy as perhaps their humor and ability to craft nice looking user interfaces and menus and think of multiple branching paths would translate well in a humoristic dating sim type game...

author: {'steamid': '76561198059223032', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 64, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 64, 'last_played': 1496678326}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a 2D clicker game.
The gameplay consists in clicking on a jar of Mayonnese to open it. You have some kind of storyline, which is unlocked by clicking on different achievment that give you tasks (for example clicking 300 times on the jar). These tasks unlock new achievments and thereby also new tasks. The names of the different achievments tell you the story and the jar of Mayonnese changes its appearance when a new task is applied.
For the achievments hunters out there, like me, the game has 50 achievments that are easily unlockable in under one hour by clicking on the jar 10000 times.
In the end, My Name is Mayo is a fun game in comparison to other clicking games. It is not very expensive, but you should try to get it for free if you can. I recommend this for people who like weird clicking games and especially for achievment hunters.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006855562', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 87, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1507800693}
review:
Well, what's there to say about this game? First of all, with 99 cent it has a pretty low price tag. You can easily get 50 achievements and a perfect game out of this by clicking a glass of mayonnaise 10000 times with a few short breaks to change its costume (yep, seriously). Sadly, that's all this game offers. The humor is somewhat okay, graphics are more like a flash game and after about half an hour to an hour you're through with this. It's not completely terrible (I played worse games), but it's also not a good or particularly entertaining game.

2 / 10

author: {'steamid': '76561198207484137', 'num_games_owned': 8328, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 131, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1485500910}
review:
Well it is a clicker game, no point in denying that, and you have to be fan of clicker games to go all the way.
Which I did, so a quick sum of the + and - here:

+ It contains mayo and humor! (Perfect combo.)
+ It contains a hidden non mayo thing. (But can't tell due spoilers sweetie, spoilers!-
+ Same Dev's as the awesome Mr. Massagy. (Admit their awesomeness!) 
+ Can't feel my finger anymore, what a work out. (+10 skill points on fingering, yes that pun had to be made)
+ Great and not too hard achievements! (I secretly want moaaaaaar)
+ The satisfaction. (Not sure how to explain, probably because I'm a clicker addict..) 

- I think my mouse is bleeding and will be death soonish... Rip. (Overclocking..., no no, overclicking!)
- Oddly enough even with it played out, I have to urge to go back in and click more... (Mooooooar)

Overall for me personally, well worth it!
I like these Dev's and their games. ‚ô°

author: {'steamid': '76561198024509107', 'num_games_owned': 1142, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 115, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 115, 'last_played': 1485293496}
review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him, 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate, you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me- 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28, I have never touched a cigarette. I must say, I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it, because this game gave me cancer anyway.

author: {'steamid': '76561198088996732', 'num_games_owned': 200, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 683, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 683, 'last_played': 1485448653}

review:
This game should be a flash game or a game for free on steam, As you can see, i have been playing this game for 0.3 hours/ 17 minutes, and already, I have all the achievments and I am requesting a refund for it, the little "funny" stories that are supposed to make you want to play the game more, are terrible, they are not even the least bit funny, and before you ask, yes I did use an auto clicker, just to speed up the game so if i didnt like it... REFUND.

its laughable that the game charges you at all, especially a dollar you could use to buy something more useful like a candy bar, and wastes your time trying to get those easily gettable achievments, this game is not worth my time and money, and the same goes for you

author: {'steamid': '76561198246004398', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1491736399}
review: The simple premise of this game can be an instant turn off for many players since the clicking genere is dead and done and theres so many other "click an object and watch your numbers grow" games to the point where its annoying to see another one of these games. But this game has introduced to me an achievement that I have never before experienced in my life, and that achievement is to 100% a game. This may seem like a joke, but in all my years of playing games I never once truly completed a video game. While that may be mostly because I prefer competitive online games, I still came through with the satisfaction of getting that last achievement of getting all achievements. This game will forever hold a special place in my heart and it truly deserves GoTY 2001.

author: {'steamid': '76561198186865498', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 82, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1484519473}
review: Okay, how does one review this game? If you fancy tapping a jar of mayo for 10,000 clicks of your mouse while unlocking weird "stories" along the way then this is an easy way to pile up 50 achievements in about an hour. A zany, offbeat little game which is worth a purchase simply to show off to people how cool gamers can be.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030414441', 'num_games_owned': 992, 'num_reviews': 39, 'playtime_forever': 234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 234, 'last_played': 1483659320}
review:
You just click on a jar of mayo under different guises and props, some of which are based on clever word play. There are a few story "arcs" which demand you to click sequentially through a number of guises (e.g. mayo as a kid, then she grew up, then she became rebellious, etc). The entire content of the game (including all achievements) requires exactly 10,000 mouse clicks. This is what you are paying $1 for, to click 10,000 times on a virtual weirdly sexualized mayo jar.

I played it between multiplayer matches to pass the time and still found it dull.
