author: {'steamid': '76561197996186819', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 95, 'playtime_forever': 72, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 72, 'last_played': 1483333539}
review:
This game lol. Is like Kellogg's Special K. It's just right. For 96 cents USD you can get about an hour of clicker fun out of it.

The aesthetics of the game is quite pleasing, reminds me of the artwork in Braid. The music is like the "Bewitched" TV show intro. All happy and whimsical.

The story comes in the form of achievements once you click the mayo jar a number of times, it unlocks the next part. Often in a non-linear way, depending on which achievement you click on to follow. You'll follow the mayo's sex life, the mayo's music band adventure, hear the mayo's philosophy on life...

I suppose it's all about observing someone growing up through life and discovering amusing random trivia along the way.

Mouse macro really helps. But the top 30 in the leaderboards more than likely modified their save game to upload an insane clicker score.

review:
Let's see... First off, I got this as a gag gift for Christmas. 

I will say... it's vaguely intriguing. For someone who first looked at this and say, "This is completely stupid" 

I ended up playing halfway through it. Granted, it only took a day to beat, but pretty interesting with the story peppered in there.

The biggest reward, is laughing my butt off once I reached the last achievement. The perfect moment when my brotehr came in saying how stupid the game was, til the last click hit. 

What do I say about this game? It's stupid, but interesting.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040830662', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 63, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1527445673}
review:
"My Name is Mayo" ist ein im Februar 2016 ver√∂ffentlichter Clicker von Green Laval Studios, der den Egoismus der Gesellschaft des 21. Jahrhunderts persifliert.

Das Werk √ºbergibt dem Spieler zu Beginn sofort die F√§higkeit zu handeln. Im Gegensatz zu anderen Spielen seiner Zeit (s. alle anderen Spiele), l√§sst "My Name is Mayo" den nicht erst in ein Men√º, sondern gibt ihm die M√∂glichkeit die M√∂glichkeiten des Spielen sofort zu erforschen. Dadurch wird von der ersten Sekunde an vermittelt, dass es sich bei "My Name is Mayo" nicht um ein Spiel handelt, dass sich an Standards h√§lt und die Gewohnheit brechen m√∂chte.
Der Spieler ist nun in der Lage das Spiel zu erkunden. Ein Klick mit der linken Maustaste l√∂st eine Reaktion des Mayonnaise-Glases vor einem aus. Ein gl√§serner Klang ert√∂nt. In der oberen rechten Ecke erscheint die Zahl "1".
Der Spieler hat etwas erreicht. Das Gef√ºhl des Erfolges wird durch die Zahl vermittelt, doch gleichzeitig auch ein Wunsch nach mehr. Der Wunsch nach mehr und zahlreiche Fragen kommen auf. Das Interesse an der Reichweite des Z√§hlers erbl√ºht. Dieser Vorgang ist eine Metapher f√ºr eine m√∂gliche soziale Interaktion zwischen Menschen. Man sieht einen Menschen und reagiert. Darauf reagiert das Gegen√ºber. Wenn diese Reaktion ansprechend ist, dann reagiert man selber erneut.
Man wagt einen n√§chsten Schritt. Ein erneuter Klick wird get√§tigt. Man √ºberwindet die Angst, dass die Interaktion ein Fehlschalg wird. Je mehr man klickt, desto st√§rker konzentriert man sich auf das Glas Mayonnaise vor einem. Die Metapher l√§sst sich fortf√ºhren. Das Gegen√ºber wird einem bekannt. Man erf√§hrt mehr. Man lernt Details kennen.
W√§hrend des Erforschens des Gegen√ºbers √∂ffnet sich das Glas Mayonnaise langsam aber sicher.
Pop-Ups berichten von trivialen Fakten und Story-Anf√§ngen. Beginnt man eine der Storys erh√§lt man Monolog-Zeilen des Gegen√ºbers. Das Glas Mayonnaise erz√§hlt Geschichten und macht Witze. Doch damit es mehr erz√§hlt muss man weiter klicken und sich immer weiter √ºberwinden. Der Klick-Z√§hler steigt auf 1.000, doch man will mehr erfahren. Nach einiger Zeit muss man vielleicht die Hand wechseln, weil ein Finger nicht mehr will, doch man will weiter klicken. Wieder wird vereutlicht, dass eine Kommunikation einige Anstrengung mit sich bringen und √úberwindung kosten kann.
Die einzelnen Story-Pfade behandeln Themen wie Sexualit√§t, Zukunfts- und Selbstfindungs√§ngste und Egoismus. Diese Theme sind im 21. Jahrhundert allgegenw√§rtig. Es gibt zahlreiche Menschen, die in der F√ºlle von Pers√∂nlichkeiten nicht mehr zu sich selbst finden k√∂nnen und sich dadurch in einer Chraktereigenschaft vertiefen und somt zu einseitigen Pers√∂nlichkeiten werden, die sie wohlm√∂glich nie sein wollten, ohne es zu merken. In Folge dessen muss unter Umst√§nden auch zu professioneller Hilfe gegriffen werden. Die Angebotsdichte f√ºr psychologische Hilfe sind dadurch seit 2011 um 25% gestiegen.
Man lauscht den Geschichten und reagiert darauf mit Bet√§tigung der Maus-Taste. Viele verschiedene Pers√∂nlichkeiten kommen dem Spieler entgegen. So ist es auch im Leben. Man lernt mit dem Laufe der Zeit viele verschiedene Menschen kennen, die alle ihre eigene Geschichte zu erz√§hlen haben.
W√§hrend der Erz√§hlungen streift das Glas-Mayonnaise verschiedene Verkleidungen, wie bespielsweise einen Bikini oder eine E-Gritarre √ºber. Doch das Glas Mayonnaise bleibt stets erkennbar. Erneut wird klar, dass der Vergleich mit einem Menschen besteht. So sieht jeder Mensch anders aus, doch sind wir im Inneren alle gleich.
Mit dem Fortschreiten des Spieles erscheinen immer mehr Fakten, wie z.B. "Even if you don't like mayonnaise, it's possible that it is in some of your favourite foods".
Nachdem man alle verschiedenen Pers√∂nlichkeiten und ihre Geschichten kennen gelernt hat, erscheint nach 10.000 Klicks die letzte Botschaft. Der Deckel des Glases erhebt sich. "Open yourself to others... Just like you opened this jar of Mayo!", wird nun verk√ºndet. Die Botschaft ist eindeutig in Form von einem Imperativ formuliert, der aber durch drei Punkte abgechw√§cht wird. Die Aufforderung klingt wie ein elterlicher Rat, der von Herzen kommt. Man solle sich √∂ffnen, genau so wie man das Glas Mayonnaise ge√∂ffnet hat. Die Nachricht vereinfacht, den Vorgang des "√ñffnens", da es eigentlich einfach ist ein echtes Glas Mayonnaise zu √∂ffnen. Doch in Wirklichkeit hat es den Spieler 10.000 Klicks und viel Zeit gekostet. Sich zu √∂ffnen klingt wie ein einfaches Vorhaben, was es aber in Wirklichkeit nicht ist. Viel lieber m√∂chte man vorher aufgeben, weil es zu anstregend ist und f√ºr einen selbst danach einfacher. Man ist egoistisch. Anstatt sich mit anderen Menschen zu besch√§ftigen und sich ihnen zu √∂ffnen, geht man lieber weg und spielt vielleicht ein Computerspiel. Doch das Computerspiel "My Name is Mayo" m√∂chte, dass man aus dem Haus geht, mit Menschen redet, sich ihnen √∂ffnet und ihre Geschichten h√∂rt, weil jeder Mensch eine andere Geschichte hat und anders aussieht, wir aber im Inneren alle gleich sind und uns verstehen und unterst√ºtzen sollten.

"My Name is Mayo" w√ºnscht sich eine offenere und soziale Gesellschaft, die sich unterst√ºtzt. Dazu l√§sst es den Spieler langsam die Geschichten von verschiedenen Charakteren erforschen, die eine zwischenmenschliche Konversation wiederspiegeln.
Meiner Meinung nach ist "My Name is Mayo" ein sehr gelungenes Werk, da es eine Botschaft vermittelt, die ich vollkommen unterst√ºtze.

author: {'steamid': '76561198008965640', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 106, 'playtime_forever': 104, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 23, 'last_played': 1476307294}
review:
I have never been so emotionally involved in a story before. My Name is Mayo takes a gothic-style, noir twist on the classic genre of mystery horror.
Set in an alternative Universe, there are only two beings left. The first is you, a disembodied hand, searching for truth. The second is Mayo. In this intense, psychological thriller, you take a trip through time to explore the dark history of Mayo, and discover just what secrets lie under the lid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198091595412', 'num_games_owned': 311, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 94, 'last_played': 1482585121}
review:
Will the real Mayo please stand up?
I repeat:
Will the real Mayo please stand up?
We're gonna have a problem here.


So, the game "My Name is Mayo" is another unique game like Montaro, Greyfox and so on.
The concept of the game is basic and easy-to-understand.
You... well, you just click on a mayonnaise jar.
And that's it.

Or is it really?

You get achievements after clicking the hell out of the jar and there won't be happening anything after a while.
This is the moment you might be wondering if you cleared the game already.
YOU'RE WRONG!
Click on the achievements you find on the top left corner and you'll be surprised... Won't tell you more than that.

This game has a story which is deep stuff and you will most probably end this game asking yourself why you spend your couple of cents on this.

You did so, because you either love mayo or you don't. Easy as that.


Well, do I recommend this game?
I would not recommend it, but since it has a little fun included you might spend your single buck on virtual mayo instead of that ice cream.

Les succ√®s servent √©galement de mini histoire, en effet certain succ√®s une fois d√©bloqu√©, il ne faut pas oublier de les s√©lectionner dans le jeu, afin de pouvoir continuer la suite de la petite histoire lui concernant. 

Rien de compliqu√© sur ce jeu, il vous faudra juste cliquer un certain nombre de fois sur le pot de mayo afin de pouvoir d√©bloquer d'autres succ√®s, qu'il vous faudra √©galement encore s√©lectionn√© dans le jeu, pour d√©bloquer la suite de la mini histoire lui correspondant.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040884867', 'num_games_owned': 2434, 'num_reviews': 901, 'playtime_forever': 50, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 41, 'last_played': 1494718048}
review:
[b]While nearly all clicker-style games are 'dumb', [i]My Name is Mayo[/i] at least investigates an interesting conceptual question, as well as having a [i]Ren and Stimpy[/i] style humor and artwork.[/b]

The question is [i]how many times do you have to tap a mayo jar to unscrew the lid?[/i] just let that fester in your brain for a quick minute.

Stating the obvious - the gameplay is purely clicking. There is no 'game' proper. The entertainment value comes from seeing the wonky artwork and quirky dialogue. This title will entertain you for exactly one very short afternoon. There isn't any replay value as far as I can tell, and it doesn't have super super grindy long-term goals like other clickers. [i]Is it worth a buck?[/i] I think so, but opinions will vary.

author: {'steamid': '76561198083203468', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1480191228}
review:
This...this isn't a game.  I'm not sure exactly what it is, but it isn't a game.  There's no luck or skill to reach the end, only determination and a low threshold for what counts as amusing...so me.  
  
At less than a thousand clicks in, I wondered just what kind of psychological experiment or absurdist troll that I am Mayo could be.  Whatever the intentions of the creator(s), I am Mayo is a masterpiece.  The creator(s) earned my dollar and you should give them a dollar, too.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081145379', 'num_games_owned': 738, 'num_reviews': 118, 'playtime_forever': 252, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 252, 'last_played': 1479678066}
review:
Un clicker MUY simple, gracioso, y muy bien acabado a nivel de detalle (est√©tica, m√∫sica).
Un juego en el que simplemente vas haciendo click en un bote de mayonesa y cada X clicks, se descubre un nuevo logro, con una peque√±a "historia" y una nueva im√°gen.
No tiene mucho m√°s.

Un juego gracioso pero... cansa, y se hace MUY mon√≥tono para la poca "recompensa" que ofrece.
Adem√°s, est√° s√≥lo en ingl√©s. Son pocos textos, pero si no conoces el idioma, te pierdes la mitad de la gracia.

Al final, por lo poco que aporta, y lo mucho que se tarda en completar el juego, te deja con la sensaci√≥n de haber tirado el tiempo a la basura...

-----------------------------------------------------

PD: un consejo; si lo juegas desde PC, puedes pulsar la barra espaciadora y hacer click a la vez. Lo har√°s la mitad de r√°pido. Y si no, utiliza alg√∫n programa de click autom√°tico tipo "AutoHotkey" para no morir en el intento. xD

author: {'steamid': '76561198063392506', 'num_games_owned': 2773, 'num_reviews': 34, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1527514808}
review:
Nun ja, "My Name is Mayo" ist ein Clickerspiel mit "Story".

Bei diesem Spiel sieht man konstant ein Mayonnaiseglas vor sich und muss mit dem Cursor darauf klicken.
F√ºr jeden erreichten Meilenstein bekommt man einen Fakt (Wei√ü nicht ob die wirklich stimmen) oder ein neues Outfit f√ºr das besagte Mayoglas. 

Damit sind wir schon an dem Punkt angekommen, wieso ich dieses Spiel bis zum letzten Achievement gespielt habe. Man kann seine Mayonnaise in verschiedene Outfits stecken. Dies sieht teilweise sogar recht lustig aus, verliert sich aber nach den ersten 10 - 20 Klicks auch wieder. 

[u]Ein Vorteil hat das Spiel:[/u]
F√ºr jemanden der Achievements jagt ist dieses Spiel super geeignet. Er muss nur 10.000 mal auf die Mayonnaise klicken und ein paar mal die Outfits wechseln. Jeder Meilenstein ist n√§mlich ein Achievement.

[b][u]Fazit:[/u][/b] F√ºr 0,99 ‚Ç¨ ganz ok... w√ºrde es mir aber nicht selber kaufen und f√ºr Achievement-J√§ger ein schnelles Spiel f√ºr Zwischendurch.

review:
Eine Mayonnaise, ein Wort: unterhaltsam!
Es kostet 99ct (habs f√ºr 50 ct bekommen) und bietet 30-300 Minuten Unterhaltung. Es geht um Mayo- auf die man klickt und neue Outfits freischaltet. Nebenbei bekommt man bei einer gewissen Klickzahl einen Randomfact. Das Spiel bietet 4 Handlungsstr√§nge die durch klicken im jeweiligen Outfit freigeschaltet werden k√∂nnen. Nebenbei gibts einiges an wertvollen Sammelkarten und man kann JEDES von den 50 Achievements leicht bekommen- bis auf das letzte 10.000 Klicks.
Viel Spa√ü
10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561197979226877', 'num_games_owned': 1429, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 47, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1473695980}
review:
To say that "My name is Mayo" changed my life is to do it a spectacular injustice.

I've tried to go back to tapping mayo in the real world, but in the end I couldn't... it's just not the same.  I deeply miss the witty banter I've had with the Mayo and without that, there is no way I can be complete.  I came into this game expecting to find $0.99 of game play and what did I find (other than about an hour of $0.99 game play)? The universe, transcendence, my soul has blossomed.

I shall never view Mayo the same way again.  God Speed Mayo.  God Speed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198090691647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 59, 'playtime_forever': 80, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 80, 'last_played': 1472594972}
review:
Vorrei scrivere una recensione decente ma il problema √®... che COSA dovrei scrivere esattamente?
Partiamo dal presupposto che √® sicuramente un ottimo gioco... per sfogare la frustrazione! Insomma, non avete mai sognato di picchiettare un barattolo di maionese? Eh? Ma... come sarebbe a dire NO?! Beh, effettivamente nemmeno io... Il punto √® che non c'√® un punto. Nemmeno una virgola... cosa ne sto facendo della mia vita?

PRO
- Poco costoso e intrattiene abbastanza (io mi sono divertita in quei 50 minuti di gioco scarsi a finire tutti gli archivi)
- Carino il sistema per sbloccare gli archivi successivi (a parte il 'clicca un tot di volte', si √® praticamente obbligati a selezionare le piccole "storie" con i vari "outfit" per il nostro barattolo)
- OMG c'√® un messaggio finale! (Questo lascio a voi scoprirlo, altrimenti che gusto c'√®?)

CONTRO
- Non √® Ketchup, purtroppo.

Oh, se pu√≤ essere sexy anche un barattolo di maionese io non so che state aspettando a giocarci! ~‚ù§

author: {'steamid': '76561198079942314', 'num_games_owned': 829, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1472542847}
review:
I really don't know what to say about this game. If you love condiment jars dressed in sexy leopard bikinis and love clicking your mouse rythemically against the cool smooth surface of mayo jars, then this is for you! 

In all serious though, being a silly game, don't have expectations too high. Be prepared to potentially beat your mouse into submission and get finger cramps...if that can..happen..

the little tiny "stories" are in the achievements themselves, which is kinda cool and original. 

This is probably the easiest and fastest game to get a perfect score. 

So if you have a disturbing love for mayo in raunchy outfits, want to add finger day to your gym regime and love cats, dogs and poops falling all across the jar, then WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR? I know you're mayo cortex is quiverin'.

review:
Dieses Klick "Abenteuer" erm√∂glicht es Ihnen, die Klick-F√§higkeit der Maus zu testen, weil Sie genau 10.000 Klicks ben√∂tigen, um das Spiel zu beenden. Diese Erfahrung wird als Simulation eines realen Abgreifen des Mayo Glas beschrieben.
W√§hrend Sie verschiedene Teile des Glases klicken, wird seine Geschichte von seinem gro√üen Wissen entdeckt.
Meine Name ist Mayo klingt wie das perfekte Spielerlebnis f√ºr Sie, aber was sind Sie bereit daf√ºr zu opfern um die Freude aus diesem Glas Mayo zu erleben?
Diese einzigartige Erfahrung kostet Sie nichtmal 1‚Ç¨.
Sie denken jetzt man k√∂nnte dieses Geld auch f√ºr einen guten Zweck spenden oder auf irgendeine andere Weise ausgeben, aber wie k√∂nnte man dieser Mayo wiederstehen?

Pro:

+Testen Sie Ihre Maus
+erfahren Sie mehr √ºber Mayo und Gl√§ser
+Holen Sie sich einfach Errungenschaften
+unglaubliche Erfahrung

Nachteile:

-1 Stunde Ihres Lebens verloren
-erfahren Sie mehr √ºber Mayo und Gl√§ser
-vielleicht zerst√∂ren Sie Ihre Maus?

Jetzt sind Sie definitiv bereit diese Delikatesse zu versuchen, Nicht wahr?

author: {'steamid': '76561197969150477', 'num_games_owned': 2460, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 27, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1468986944}
review:
It's a clicker game. Not much else

Pros -
If you're into achievements it's easy to get 100%

Cons -
Pretty much everything else

Bottom Line - 
This "game" is pretty awful. Clicker games can be fun and enjoyable. This one? Not so much. This is literally one of the only games I've ever considered trying to get a refund on.

author: {'steamid': '76561198121829588', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 33, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1482183721}
review: Haven't finished this wonderful game yet, but man, is it a good one. Being apart of the Mayonnaise family, I am able to say that this game really turns me on when it comes to touching a jar of mayonnaise over and over, until I produce a little mayonnaise myself. You may think that this game looks bland, but it's worth the dollar or so that it costs. My favorite costume, without a doubt, is the whipped cream bikini. I could click on that all day if I were able to. At the end of the day though, after a long day of clicking on my native jar of mayonnaise that I call dad, I highly support and respect anyone that purchases this game and enjoys it as much as I do.

author: {'steamid': '76561198085309975', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1472059386}
review:
Riveting story, breathtaking graphics, and intense gameplay. My Name is Mayo is truly the pinnacle of human achievement where gaming is concerned.

And you will probably need a new mouse afterward.

author: {'steamid': '76561198089299679', 'num_games_owned': 7216, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 299, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 299, 'last_played': 1472054827}
review:
Open yourself. Just like opening this jar of Mayo!

After 30+ minutes of spam clicking. I finnaly 100% this game.

Not much to it.. just click the jar.. earn achivement. Select newly acquired achivement. Dress up the mayo jar... Click the Jar and repeat. Very simple and straight forward.

No story, barely any music, nice sound effect, dress us mayo jar simulator.

Just run this game.. click 10k times. Get all the achievement then exit the game forever.

6.5/10.. A pointless clicker spam game for easy 100% achivement ratio.

author: {'steamid': '76561198023484674', 'num_games_owned': 6298, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 1077, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1077, 'last_played': 1472018826}
review: It takes 10,000 clicks to complete the game, and not much happens along the way.  It has a fun aesthetic, but it has very little content even for a clicker game.  All that happens is you click for a while, unlock an achievement which gives the jar an 'outfit', then repeat.  Should definitely be free.  I might recommend it if it were free, but at the moment, a lot of better things are.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115488642', 'num_games_owned': 187, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 14, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1471365148}

author: {'steamid': '76561198061582156', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 200, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 200, 'last_played': 1470262641}
review:
Sit there and ask yourself "What's the best game of 2016?". You probably came up with all sorts of things like Overwatch, Dark Souls 3, Battlefield 1, and of course Pokemon GO. Well throw those horrible games out the window because My Name is Mayo is the only game you will ever need. Truly a magnum opus of the entire gaming industry and a testament to the power of human ingenuity. At the end of this wonderful 99 cent journey you will emerge as a better man, a champion of clicking, and a god of mayonnaise.

10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198020755119', 'num_games_owned': 298, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 241, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 241, 'last_played': 1470266664}
review:
[h1]I thought it will be a funny game, like "What's under your blanket"[/h1]

[b]I didn't have my hopes up when I bought this game, but atleast I thought it will give me a laugh or two, after watching the video connected to the store page. But no, it gave me nothing, just a bad experience. This game is not funny at all, makes no sense at all, and does not worth it's price tag at all. But, I saw that the developers are planning to do something with it, but still, my hopes are low. If a miracle would happen, and the update would change the whole game - which I don't really think will happen - then I will change my review.[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198025540438', 'num_games_owned': 7104, 'num_reviews': 559, 'playtime_forever': 395, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 395, 'last_played': 1470114690}
review: You click the jar 10k times, then you win. Sometimes you get a cheevo with some flavor text, and sometimes the cheevos unlock little costumes for the jar. I feel like the cheevos were trying to make jokes, but if they were, none of them were funny. They'd maybe be funny in the same way that King of the Buttons was funny when I played it on Newgrounds when I was 13, but the fact is that most of the LoLS0R4ndumb humor you found funny when you were 13 watching flash animations just isn't funny to anyone aside from other 13 year olds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198058584412', 'num_games_owned': 9611, 'num_reviews': 204, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1469812178}
review:
Even if you know what you're getting into with this game, I still can't really recommend it.  If it goes on sale for 25 cents, you'll probably make your money back in cards, so there is that, and it works, there just could have been more.  The stories could have been fleshed out more, there could have been more facts, if you're paying attention and switching when you unlock the achievements, the slog from 4,500 clicks to 10,000 clicks is just long and boring.

While not a bad game, it's just shallow.  If you're looking for a cheap +1 to your game count, and 50 achievements you should get in an hour or so without really paying attention, then this game will do that.  You'll likely have to keep the game running longer than it takes to beat it if you want to get all the cards.  It is something mindless and easy to play while watching tv or a movie, though, so there is that.

All in all, there are better clicker games out there that are free, so I can't really recommend wasting an hour with this one.

author: {'steamid': '76561198234234796', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 40, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1490663528}
review:
Welcome to the retro world of My Name is Mayo, an obscure title that lives up to its name. An entertaining and hilarious, never-ending causal clicking game that will give you a craving for mayonnaise and aching finger workout that will make you come back for more clicking goodness! It‚Äôs a brilliant timewaster, a blast of fun, and a relaxing activity after long day of staring at the computer screen at work.

Plus checkout at all those achievements, you‚Äôll be ‚ÄúYee Gods, look at all the Achievements‚Äù! Each achievement tells a wild and (at times) a bizarre story about a Mayo Jar. From Random Facts about life to a banana, a censored mayo jar, and so on. You will be laughing your brains out from pure enjoyment of such a silly and joyful game!

I highly recommended it to anybody who loves causal games, comedy, or mayonnaise.

This game deserves 10/10 delicious jars of Mayo!

review:
[h1]Holy Mayo![/h1]

So...I'm not eating the mayo, I'm just tapping the jar over and over?
Wait, I'm not even doing that, I'm just [i]playing a game[/I] about tapping a jar over and over!

What is wrong with me?

[u]Play [I]My Name is Mayo[/I] if the following applies:[/u]
[list]
[*]You like absurdist humor
[*]You fantasize about the great, white condiment
[*]You want to earn 50 achievements in less than 20 minutes
[*]You like your clicker games with a bit more story and a bit less Ketchup
[/list]
10/10 Would stick a jar of mayo in my armpit again!

review:
Avez-vous toujours r√™v√© d'√™tre un pot de mayonnaise, un pot ayant ses probl√®mes personnels, ses humeurs, sa mentalit√© ? Oui ? Alors achetez ce jeu.

Il n'y a pas grand chose √† dire sur [i]My name is Mayo[/i] en dehors du fait que vous aurez une bonne excuse pour vous acheter une nouvelle souris et de nouveaux doigts. Niveau graphismes on va pas se mentir c'est pas [i]Avatar[/i] ou le dernier film en 4K, mais ce petit pot de mayonnaise porte aussi son charme. De plus, la musique et les sons sont de bonne qualit√©, et gardent dans l'ambiance. Notons par ailleurs l'humour pr√©sent dans ce titre qui ne se prend pas au s√©rieux.

Pour r√©sumer, j'√©voquerai que ce jeu passe-temps a un bon rapport qualit√©/prix.

Note: 14/20

author: {'steamid': '76561198055801447', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1467088656}
review:
Du hast Lust deine Maus hinzurichten?
Du willst zum Arzt deines Vertrauens gehen um dir den Gelben Urlaubsschein zu holen wegen einer Sehnenscheidenentz√ºndung? 
Du willst ein Spiel mit 100%  Errungenschaften f√ºr deine Sammelsucht?

Dann ist das DEIN Spiel!

Man hat einen Bildschirm mit einem Glas Mayonnaise in der Mitte, mehr gibts nicht zu sehen. Auf dieses Glas klickt man, solange bis man alle Achievments hat. Hat man die ersten, werden die n√§chsten im Optionsmen√º freigeschaltet. Diese kann man dann anw√§hlen, freispielen und das n√§chste ausw√§hlen. Nach ca. 1 Stunde hat man dann alle 50 Erfolge freigeschaltet, je nachdem ob man das Durchhalteverm√∂gen besitzt f√ºrs Dauerklicken oder vorher ob dieser Stumpfsinnigkeit dem Wahnsinn verfallen ist. Dann noch solange laufen lassen bis man die 3 Karten abgestaubt hat ( immerhin so ca 15 Cent wert ), und deinstallieren. 

Fazit: Mit einem SPIEL hats nix zu tun, aber perfekt f√ºr Achievmenthunter. Deshalb Daumen hoch!

review:
First, I need to point out that I Hate Mayo, stems from my childhood.

Second, I found this game because of, you guessed it, Markiplier. Being on sale I grabbed it to get a nice and easy 100%. So take a look at the time spent playing, thats how long it took. Could have easily taken less if my macro worked right.

Yes I used a clicker... the game isn't worth destroying my mouse with over 10K clicks. If you don't mind or have a cheap enough mouse by all means speed through it, otherwise use a macro that works only a little bit.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030516476', 'num_games_owned': 5534, 'num_reviews': 465, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1554550056}
review:
Trois ans apr√®s avoir jou√© √† ce jeu, et dans un soucis de remanier mon √©valuation de l'√©poque que je trouvais une peu trop courte et √©vasive, j'ai d√©cid√© de r√©installer et relancer le jeu.

Force est de constater que celui-ci a toujours ce m√™me impacte qu'il a eu sur moi la premi√®re fois : il est tellement ridicule et tourn√© √† la d√©rision qu'il a le don de susciter l'√©tonnement et l'amusement. Ce jeu a son lot de d√©tracteurs et son lot de fans aussi... En tout cas ce qui est sur c'est qu'on se souvient encore de son titre.

Certains l'ont appr√©ci√© pour ses succ√®s faciles et cartes √† √©changer, rien de plus, rien de moins. 
D'autres pour ses graphismes vintage qui lui octroient un certain charme ou pour son c√¥t√© grotesque.  Et d'autres n'y ont rien trouv√© de plus qu'un jeu d√©bile o√π il faut seulement spammer un pot de mayonnaise en plein milieu d'un √©cran juste pour obtenir des succ√®s.

Pour ma part, j'ai bien aim√© ce petit "jeu" compl√®tement barr√©. Apr√®s tout, que cherche-t-on dans dans un jeu si ce n'est des surprises et de la nouveaut√© nous permettant de nous √©vader du quotidien afin de se d√©tendre et s'amuser.

Il n'est certes pas le jeu du si√®cle, ni celui sur lequel on s'acharnera des heures durant et d'ailleurs on y rep√©rera tout de suite ses d√©fauts majeurs. 
En effet,  √† peine lanc√© et ceci dans une configuration qui est tout sauf du HD, que nous voici d√©j√† projet√©s dans le vif du sujet sans aucune cin√©matique ou image d'introduction, ni aucun menu, ou encore  sans une quelconque indication nous expliquant pourquoi un pot de mayonnaise tr√¥ne au milieu de l'√©cran et ce que l'on est sens√©s faire de √ßa.
Apr√®s, c'est s√ªr nul besoin d'√™tre sortit de l'ENA pour comprendre qu'il suffit de cliquer dessus.

Je ne me passionne pas vraiment pour les jeux dit "clicker" mais ici j'ai bien appr√©ci√© le concept : cliquer un certain nombre de fois fait tomber des succ√®s, pas seulement dans notre compte steam mais aussi dans le jeu. 
On peu ensuite aller les consulter en cliquant sur le bouton pause en haut de l'√©cran. Cliquer sur l'un d'entre eux aura pour effet de l'activer, et en les activant √† tour de r√¥le dans un certain ordre tout en retournant cliquer sur notre pot de mayo, cela d√©voilera une sorte d'arborescence et par le biais de quelques phrases, plusieurs petites histoires marrantes et saugrenues.

J'ai √† l'√©poque, d√©sinstall√© le jeu un peu trop t√¥t et j'ai loup√© une petite mise √† jour qui ajoutais un petit bonus que j'ai d√©couvert aujourd'hui. En utilisant le clic droit il y a une petit surprise qui n'est pas non plus ph√©nom√©nale mais c'est un petit plus bien sympa.

That's all, rien de plus √† expliquer, le jeu est tr√®s court, et il faut se munir d'une souris robuste et pr√©voir un massage intensif des doigts apr√®s avoir fini la partie.

Il n'y avait peut √™tre pas de quoi en faire tout un plat, ni de r√©diger un si long paragraphe pour si peu, mais j'avais comme l'envie subite de d√©terrer un vieux topique oubli√© et d'offrir un peu de lecture comme √ßa par plaisir.


[code][h1][b]Si vous avez appr√©ci√© cette √©valuation et souhaitez en lire d'autres venez suivre ma [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/39072619/]page de curation[/url].[/b][/h1][/code]

author: {'steamid': '76561198072372214', 'num_games_owned': 1764, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 209, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 209, 'last_played': 1464823205}
review:
This game is absurd, but I like it. It has a nice retro feel, a cheesy set of stories, random factoids, and a completely strange way of presenting it all. Story progression is done by selecting an achievement and resuming clicking. It would've been nice if the story achievements were somehow displayed on the main screen instead of having to go into the list and find the next one, but it was simple enough to blaze through them.

I highly recommend using an auto clicker. 10,000 clicks is murder for your hand and mouse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198049081370', 'num_games_owned': 751, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 249, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 249, 'last_played': 1456002054}
review:
Foi engra√ßado nos primeiros 100 cliques! :B

author: {'steamid': '76561198045331223', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 438, 'playtime_forever': 291, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1489974077}
review:
This game is silly and entertaining :D

One huge con for me is that there aren't more customizations or effects to be unlocked.
A bigger one and the most frustrating is that I have a PC, along with my Bro, and GF, all three of us jump on the other PCs and the local files get erased.  For example, I was at 6000-7000 hits, and then my girlfriend jumps on, and gets hers to 1700.  I log back into my account, and I'm also at 1700 hits, that's very frustrating, given that I was only 3000hits away from all achievements.

review: This game is so random, but in my opinion worth the one dollar!! If you do not like playing only clicking games, then this game is not for you; you can very easily spend up to 5,000 clicks. For what it's worth though, it's guranteed to make you smile! My boyfriend tells me that I play the weirdest games, so I am very glad to have added this game to the "weird games"  category!

author: {'steamid': '76561198076327839', 'num_games_owned': 186, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 46, 'last_played': 1460674535}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a simple clicker game. Sit and click on a mayo jar for an hour or two to unlock acheivements. 

The "story mode" is activated by clicking on the jar while a prior achievement is selected, which changes the appearance of the jar. Some of the thresholds for achievements are very high, but it is extremely easy to max them out in a short period of time.

In the end, My Name is Mayo is nothing more than "filler" in your Steam library. Finish it once and never turn back. However, for only $0.99, the game is not too terrible a deal. I got it on sale for $0.49. This is pocket change, people. Nothing worth getting fired up about. In fact, sell off some of your inventory and you'll be able to purchase games like this in no time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034636336', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 114, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 114, 'last_played': 1461912190}
review:
If you want to perfectly emulate this game, watch the trailer while clicking your mouse on the bottle of mayo in the picture above the description. You have experienced the game and saved 99 cents.

The trailer gives you a good idea of the game's humor, which is the only selling point. Do you find it funny to see a jar of mayo with an emo haircut? What about dressed as a banana? If so, spend the dollar. You might get a few laughs. If not, don't bother.

To unlock all the achievements, you'll have to click the mayo 10,000 times. Clicking progresses you through little storylines. Getting through all of these will take you roughly 4,000 clicks. After that it's 6,000 clicks with nothing new or entertaining (again, opinion, maybe you find poop rain really amusing and that will be enough for you). When that's done, you just let it idle for cards. That's all there is.

I didn't find it fun or funny and, ultimately, it made me kind of sad.

author: {'steamid': '76561198193364095', 'num_games_owned': 631, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 193, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 193, 'last_played': 1461844884}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a short clicker game that was gifted to me by a friend who knows that I prefer Mayonnaise over Ketchup. 
[spoiler] [b]Mayo > Ketchup[/b][/spoiler]

Just another clich√© clicker game.
In my opinion, I found it very boring and I wouldn't recommend this game if you're looking for something that's going to [i]impact[/i] you in any sort.
This game is good enough to help you kill time.

My Name is Mayo has 50 achievements which is very easy to get. You'll be able to get 100% in one sitting so this game is obviously for you if you're an achievement hunter looking for easy achievements! The achievements require you to have a number of clicks to unlock it and some consists of a one-liner story which made me chuckle. Out of the 50 achievements, 12 of them are random facts and the rest are 4 different story plots which changes the ‚Äòclothes‚Äô of the Mayonnaise jar. 

The game also has trading cards sooo if you're someone who's in it for steam trading cards, go for this.

I'm not really asking for much since it's only a ‡∏ø29.00 / $0.99 game. 
It's a plain game where you have to click a jar several times to unlock achievements and that's all there is to it. Plus, repetitive music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198147367577', 'num_games_owned': 253, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 22, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1463876858}
review: So here's my review for "My Name is Mayo". It's a simple clicking game about you clicking on a jar of mayo with your finger, unlocking achievements so and on, and getting "stories" (from achievements) which just add an accessory to your jar of mayo. It really gets boring, but you should play it (IF YOU BOUGHT THIS OH MY GOD) as a time waster. Don't waste your money on this please, instead save it for your bright future and ACTUALLY WASTE IT ON A GOOD GAME.

author: {'steamid': '76561198139328230', 'num_games_owned': 2324, 'num_reviews': 260, 'playtime_forever': 110, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 110, 'last_played': 1461326439}
review:
Here is the not so heroic journey of trying to open one friggin' stubborn mayonnaise jar, presented as a clicker game full with sarcastic achievements. Uhm... Okay. I won this game in a giveaway and tried it out of pure curiosity to begin with, which doesn't serve me right most of the time. Writing a review for this one will be a challenge. I really should appreciate the way developers' mind work here. Even now I'm trying to get my head together to think about something imaginative to say about a mayonnaise jar, and as absurd it may be, some people managed to make a whole game out of it!

Ehm... [i]My Name is Mayo[/i] is a clicker game - and aside not really being the most absurd one that I've ever seen in the market either, has a weird sense of humor targeting a selection of pop culture references wrapped in a vintage display. There is really nothing into it aside clicking on a mayonnaise jar while listening to the repetition of the same pesky 40s advertisement jingle tune. After a certain amount of clicking, you unlock short and absurd story paths for your mayonnaise jar and given the opportunity to dress it up in various accessories. As being the mission of any and all clicker games, your primary motivation here is to kill some brain cells while looking at your screen with empty eyes, silently drooling and clicking with your mouse to fill the illusion of you are actually doing something. Well done! It takes 10.000 clicks to collect all that there is within this game, never to visit again. If you are a strict achievement hunter and got it for an easy completion; sure, this is your game. You might consider running a script rather than actually clicking it through anyhow though.

Could I recommend it? Sure, why not if you strictly know what is it that you are getting here? I, myself prefer games with actual stories but also know first handedly the mindless therapeutic relaxation of being able to not think anything serious as a long time player of [i]Clicker Heroes[/i]. [i]My Name is Mayo[/i] is a perfect medium for that. The game deserves some appreciation for being humorous without being imposing, obnoxious or promising false depth anyhow. While we ponder on the philosophy, the boundless ethical and existential conflict hidden behind a mayonnaise jar, we keep clicking. Will we ever grasp the enlightenment?

Please also check out Lady Storyteller's Curator page [url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/ladystoryteller#curation]here[/url] - follow for regular updates on reviews for other games!

author: {'steamid': '76561198049196395', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 86, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 92, 'last_played': 1527478111}
review: Very Positive? What is wrong with these people? This is a pointless clicker game. The only thing going for it is that it's super easy to get all the achievements and it has cards. I do not recommend this game unless you are into Steam cards. It's barely a game but yet it plays better than Bad Rats, go figure. I got all the achievements and wrote this review before all the cards dropped. I can't believe there is a leaderboard for this game with people clicking in the millions. This game is awful and you should feel awful. 1/10 if you want to waste your time with this piece of shovelware.

author: {'steamid': '76561198069011828', 'num_games_owned': 1457, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 155, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 155, 'last_played': 1461433592}
review:
Dieses Spiel ist nix f√ºr unge√ºbte Gamer ! Mit Klickfingerkrampf ist nicht zu Spa√üen !

My Name is Mayo ist dazu gut, um noch ein perfektes Spiel in der Statistik zu haben. Oder um der ollen PC-Maus mit der klickerei auf das Mayoglas den Rest zu geben. Das Spiel macht keinen Spa√ü, da hilft es auch nicht, wenn das Mayoglas einen Bikini und Schnautzbart tr√§gt. Zum Gl√ºck ist die Hintergrund Dudelei nicht nervt√∂tend.
Nach einer knappen Stunde klickerei hatte ich alle Achievements.
Danach nur noch laufen gelassen f√ºr die Karten und anschliessend deinstalliert.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068476306', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1467117405}
review:
Also das Spiel l√§uft astrein. Kein Lag, keine Bugs, keine Abst√ºrze. Die Grafik ist in einer Zeichentrickoptik gehalten und sieht vollkommen in Ordnung aus. 

Ein kleiner Mangel in meinen Augen ist, dass Klicks, welche kurz unter dem Deckel plaziert werden, nicht gelten. Daf√ºr werden Klicks, welche unter den unteren Ecken plaziert werden, als Treffer gewertet, obwohl an dieser Stelle definitiv kein Glas mehr ist. Eventuell sollte hier in kommenden Updates oder Pacthes nachgebessert werden.

Ansonsten h√§lt das Spiel, was es verspricht. Klicke zehntausendmal auf die linke Maustaste. Mehr nicht...sinnlos vielleicht...aber es wird auch nirgendwo etwas anderes behauptet :P

review: Juego estupido del a√±o... o de la decada, me gustan los clicker, pero esto ya es basura. Que tenga tantos votos positivos es una conspiraci√≥n. A mi me gusto Dear Esther, me gusta el minimalismo. Que no te enga√±en, eso es una basuda disfrazada de modernismo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198034183306', 'num_games_owned': 1779, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1463216666}
review:
The fact this got on steam is a sign of how poor the QA is.

Games that are plain crap? Okay, there is /some/ leniency there. Just a little.

A game that you do nothing but click 10,000 times for no benefit? No. This is not a game. This garbage belongs in a bin.

At least in other clicker games - even the trashiest, like Sakura Clicker - you have to upgrade and progress. This, you click 10000 times and pop achievements.

The fact someone is charging for it is offensive.

This game may not have the most advanced mechanics (or any mechanics). But what is does have is a sense for puns, a reasonable pricetag and great capacity to give you carpal tunnel syndrome (unless you want to play it hard core without auto clickers).

12/10 - IGN

author: {'steamid': '76561198059934690', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 88, 'playtime_forever': 13, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 13, 'last_played': 1461039635}
review:
Not worth paying money for, but has a few very small redeeming qualities.


+Waste time on getting 100% achievements
+Leave game running for trading cards
+Chuckle at literal interpretations of figures of speech and other silliness
+Takes at most 10 minutes to finish if using an autoclicker (highly recommended to avoid RSI)
+Makes you re-evaluate your life ("WTF did I just buy and finish this when I already knew it would be just me clicking 10,000 times?")
+It has leaderboards in case you're that autistic


-Go slowly insane after hearing the mayo jar "clink" sound effect 10,000+ times (mute the sound ASAP)
-Realise you're not getting those minutes of your life back (Steam doesn't refund time)

author: {'steamid': '76561198004630254', 'num_games_owned': 1791, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 702, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 702, 'last_played': 1460389588}
review:
This game is a joke. The punchline? Those who have been giving it negative reviews.

It's an amusing distraction that, by its' very existence, is a commentary on the inanity of clicker games and achievement hunting. There are also little "story modes" as you progress your clicks that are quite worth the time. 

The description makes it clear what this game is all about. So for people to come on here complaining that it's not really a game, that it's a waste of time....you've just added to the layers of this creation, and I thank you for it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043141500', 'num_games_owned': 4721, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1460104743}
review:
It's the only clicker I've met that comes with the decency of honesty: it very barely asks you to click on a jar of mayo 10000 times. No "your hero becomes stronger by your equally heroic click finger", no "each click will hoard delicious resources". Nothing that became the gaming sickness of the last years (let's leave aside the *philosophical* problem of most of our games just making us click on stuff). Clickers are strange games, and like good old cow clicker, Mayo is more a parody of your run-of-the-mill fingerbreaker than a true game.

But it is parody with some nicely drawn images and a few hilarious moments in its micronarratives. Pick it up on sale because it really is overpriced at a dollar. But in a sale, why not. Use an auto-clicker if you want, just enjoy the weirdness and then some mayo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053568113', 'num_games_owned': 4851, 'num_reviews': 351, 'playtime_forever': 331, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1460063553}
review:
I don't understand why this game has so much positive reviews. It's a clicking game, but a very, very bad one! All you have to do, is click on the same exact spot on the jar of mayo, every 100, 500, 1000 milestones, then, you unlock some achievements. You also have "stories" which are just 1 line of text with a different accessory that goes on the jar... You click like 50 times and then you pick another icon and keep going.

So I did that for 30 minutes and guess what? I've completed the game. Really what is the purpose of this game? It wasn't fun, it was extremely boring, short and repetitive!

If the game was free, sure! But it cost money... I truly 100% cannot recommend this game. It wasn't remotely fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561198093603927', 'num_games_owned': 2139, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1460046284}
review:
It's a 'click this and get achievements game'
Unlock certain achievements, click with them 'active' and unlock the next bit. 

I have a Mad Catz MMO TE mouse, so I just programmed a macro to click for me, clicked about a hundred times (my mouse clicking a hundred more each time) and voila. easy.
Achievements earned, time wasted.

Not a 'game' as much as an artistic statement

author: {'steamid': '76561198032518991', 'num_games_owned': 591, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 91, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 91, 'last_played': 1459861356}
review:
After getting addicted to Cookie Clicker for the 3rd time I figured I might as well go on a fully blown clicking rampage. It's one of the most honest games out there.  It is indeed just a touching story of a mayo.

I really liked the fact that the achievements serve some practical story-telling purpose, I'm always overjoyed when games do this.

Made the mistake of eating a mayo sadwich while playing it and now my throat feels like I've swallowed a can of oil.


"Open yourself to others...
Just as you opened this jar of Mayo!"

author: {'steamid': '76561197963717418', 'num_games_owned': 1842, 'num_reviews': 29, 'playtime_forever': 304, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 304, 'last_played': 1459775392}
review:
Machine √† d√©stresser (ou pas), ce jeux propose purement et simplement de faire des clicks, en r√©fl√©chissant (ou pas) √† autre chose, sur un pot de mayonnaise.... qui suivant le mode d√©marr√© permet de compl√©ter 5 mini histoires tr√®s exitantes (ou pas). Plus on avance dans "l'histoire", plus il faut clicker pour avoir la suite de celle-ci et plus on avance dans l'histoire et plus on souhaite (ou pas) savoir la suite. Entre-temps vos clicks sont comptabilis√©s car √©videmment il y a des "succ√®s" et le dernier d'entre-eux est d'avoir cliqu√© 10000 fois et s'auto-satisfaire d'un but (ou pas) bien m√©rit√© (ou pas)... en tous cas tous ces clicks ne sont pas perdu puisque sans avoir fait cela vous auriez probablement (ou pas) fais plus ou moins les m√™mes mouvements le pantalon sur les chevilles et sans souris (ou pas) bien que dans le jeux la mayonnaise ne s'√©parpille jamais...En tous cas je suis soulag√© de l'avoir termin√©... En conclusion, ce plaisir ou un autre ne vous rendra pas plus int√©lligent (peu √™tre l√©g√®rement plus muscl√©) sauf si vous avez pris le temps de r√©fl√©chir pour coder un programme qui click √† votre place. Si comme moi vous √™tes  convaincu du "Compl√®tement inutile donc absolument indispensable", je vous recommandes fortement ce jeux. Sur ce, je vais diner et je vais certainement manger du Ketchup car la mayonnaise c'est plus gras et ca fait mal au poignet...

UP: plus joli en plus soft que le jeux "wha't is under your blanket?"

author: {'steamid': '76561198152621504', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 52, 'last_played': 1561699140}
review:
Simplemente: Hay que tenerlo!

- No esperes un gran desafio (unicamente para tu mouse- excelente juego para testear su resistencia xD 
- Aunque a simple vista no lo parezca, tiene trama: esta dividido en "etapas y personalidades", y cada una de ellas tiene su historia.
- Alto contenido humoristico ( y sarcastico )
- Excelente grafica retro (en los logros)
- Muy creativo (MUY)

Facil, simple, corto, divertido y barato, cualidades que no se pueden pasar por alto ;)

review: For a buck this game isnt bad. Yes you get the main idea of ALL the physical game play from the video above, but I think they made it clear that this was all youd be doing. The more you click the more you hear about random silly stories and they jar dresses up according to the part of each story you are cicking through. You pick a story as you unlock them and can read through according to color coded mini chapters concisting of a few sentances each. The more you click while dressing you jar within the lates chapter of a story, the closer you get to hearing the end of the silly short tail. It is a very short game, but entertaining for the bored achievment lover. Its a good gift for yourself if you are having trouble sleeping and are bored out of your mind ;)

author: {'steamid': '76561197996890045', 'num_games_owned': 3060, 'num_reviews': 293, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 59, 'last_played': 1528354765}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a clicker game.
There are no skills needed to play this "game" (I use the word "game" loosely here, because it is not what I would normally think of as a game).
All you need to do is to continuously click on a big picture of a jar of mayonnaise.

There are various achievements, all of which involve clicking on the big jar of mayo.
You need to activate most achievements by clicking on the relevant achievement icon, which will change the look of the mayo jar, and you then click away for the prescribed number of times.

I had heard that this "game" was all about clicking on a jar of mayo, but I felt sure that there had to be something more to it than that - well, I suppose the inclusion of some achievements gave it something more, but it certainly wasn't much more.

To finish all of the achievements for My Name is Mayo, all you have to do is click the right number of times on the right picture of the jar of mayo, and then do a few thousand more clicks. All up, it takes 10,000 clicks to finish.

The only reasons I could think of for playing this game are:
1) You intend to write a review of it. (I can tick that box).
2) You are really really really bored, with absolutely nothing else to do.
3) You want to get some Steam cards; either to sell, or for a new badge.
4) You are a "stat wh*re", wanting to raise your "Avg. Game Completion Rate" on Steam.
5) You are an odd person with a psychiatric problem (like some sort of masochistic disorder, or Munchausen syndrome) who wants to get RSI.

The odds are if you play this game too much, you will end up with a repetitive strain injury.

Unless you fall into one of the above 5 categories, don't buy My Name is Mayo - even if it is on special.
You have been warned!

author: {'steamid': '76561198124648739', 'num_games_owned': 1579, 'num_reviews': 188, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1486587218}
review:
First of all, this game is only good for the achievement hunters or obviously for game collectors.

In this clicking game it's your job to keep clicking on a useless yar with no way of making sense.
This game has close to zero content and is based on clicking constantly on one target.
Maybe you would wonder why i recommend this game, well it's amazingly easy to get all the achievements and farm a complete game, nice for achievement hunters like me.

However, this game is a good example of shitty products on Steam and everyone wonders how this game could have passed greenlight.
I bought it for 0,60 euro and that's not too bad for an easy 100% achievements game.

I won't make a line up of all good and bad things as it's very simple; this game has easy achievements and a bad gameplay, bad game design and lack of content.
I just appreciate it that they made the achievements so easy so that's why i upvote this game.
But we should understand all of us, that this should be a one time happening, if all shitty developers will make shitty games with easy achievements to attract achievement hunters than the value of getting an achievement will dramatically go down.

Thanks developers for this one time opportunity.
Over and out !

author: {'steamid': '76561198028125071', 'num_games_owned': 11671, 'num_reviews': 74, 'playtime_forever': 227, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 38, 'last_played': 1466847187}
review:
You know how if you ever got super bored in class at school you'd type "1 + 1 =" and then keep pressing equals while watching the number increment?

This is a video game that replicates that, and they're charging money for it. There's no gameplay. There's no content. There is just a number that goes up when you click. And it doesn't even do that half the time - click too fast and it'll just stop working.

There are plenty of good, free incremental games on Steam and the internet at large. Play those instead.

EDIT: Oh, also of note - my 0.6 hours of gameplay? That's how long it took me to 100% complete this "game". This is not an incremental in the ilk of Cookie Clicker where there's any kind of ongoing gameplay. This is a single joke repeated 40 times for about a minute each and then the game is over with absolutely no replay value.

author: {'steamid': '76561198097860849', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 221, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 130, 'last_played': 1457808902}
review:
According to the many negative reviews, I have to say: You know what you're buying.

You know it's a game, where you will be just clicking and clicking.
The game is very cheap, also you can't seriously expect something more or serious. But of course, compared to the rest of indie crap here it's overpriced.
The story is not heart-touching, it's actually kinda mess to see some point in it meanwhile you click between the achievements.

This game is more like designer's piece. If you like art of 50's and 60's, you will really like the graphic design.
The task is really simple and it's up to you how you will deal with it. If you wanna challenge yourself and set up a goal for a day with clicking or you will whine it's stupid game, where you are just clicking even if you knew it in advance.

I can pretty imagine this game as an advertising supporting game for some real mayo producer for free.

70/100

author: {'steamid': '76561197986360343', 'num_games_owned': 1568, 'num_reviews': 866, 'playtime_forever': 295, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 61, 'last_played': 1527540580}
review:
Two college roommates are about to go to bed. The guy in the top bunk has his girlfriend sleeping over. To try and keep quiet, they devise a code. His girlfriend will say "tomato" if she wants him to go slower and "lettuce" for him to go faster. As they begin to make love, the girl starts to moan, "Lettuce, lettuce, tomato, tomato!" The roommate on the bottom bunk wakes up the next morning and says, "Stop making sandwiches at night. You got mayonnaise in my eye!"

[u]Some interesting facts of mayonnaise:[/u]

--- As a sauce it wasn't used till the early 19th century. You wouldn't have guessed it, would you?
--- Its name originates from the French word moyeu which means egg yolk.
--- Mayo offers a very fast way to get fat - one tablespoon can contain almost 100 calories.
--- It does NOT have a short shelf life: various preservatives and acids are added so that it can be lengthened (contrary to popular beliefs).
--- Although some might find it difficult to believe, there are countries where mayo is preferred to ketchup. In the Netherlands, for instance.
--- Very good against sunburns! Eases the pain quickly and reduces the burning sensation (verified by myself).

Oh, about the game: get it if you want one more game with 100% achievement completion. It requires 10 thousand clicks (can be achieved in roughly an hour). As an extra challenge, don't use any autoclicker software. 'Nuff said!

author: {'steamid': '76561198102953733', 'num_games_owned': 246, 'num_reviews': 23, 'playtime_forever': 565, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 563, 'last_played': 1527214405}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a simple clicker game that can be addictive. It is a short game with really no purpose besides "learning the true meaning of mayo". Here are some of my pros and cons on the game.

My Pros:
Fun to idle/play around with the stories while you are tapping Mayo 
You can get all the achievements easily (got like 50% of them within 7 minutes)
Different "costumes/gamemodes" that are achievable after playing each story

My Cons:
The Price (It is $1. Luckily I got it for 40 cents in a sale)

Personally I like the game because I like simple indie/clicker games. If you don't like short games, you should DEFINITELY not  get this game, especially for the price. Overall, it is a good game, especially if you like getting an easy 100% game.

review:
It's not worth to call it a game. It's just clicking with left mouse button or SPACE on the mayonnaise the whole time...
without thinking, no tactic... nothing. The "music" doesn't change and the animations are really primitive. 
I guess every game which you can get for free is better and more meaningful. 

Just people who collect Steamachievements should buy this game. But just if they like to get achievements without a challenge.

Tip: For the people who want to make the 10.000 clicks - you are faster if you click space with the left hand and the mouse button with the right hand at the same time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040779803', 'num_games_owned': 837, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 197, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1456760875}
review:
This game is a godsend. A masterpiece amongst the drivel that populates the gaming scene that is produced by giant mega greed corporations such as EA and Ubisoft. It brings to the table a story as strong as the Witcher 3, a tale of love as sad as Shakespeare's finest and tactical gameplay among the likes of CIV 5 and action like that of Counter Strike. 

I could not be more pleased with what has been given to me, and how riveted I was for the time it took me to play and complete this expansive world following the tale of solidarity this jar of mayonnaise follows. This should be immortalized in the halls of the Louvre for how revolutionary it is. 

I give this game a solid 10/10

I fuckin love mayo

author: {'steamid': '76561198013732450', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 49, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 49, 'last_played': 1456327804}
review:
My Name is Mayo is a beautiful work of art of the gaming industry that includes very intense clicking gameplay and many different interesting stories.  I loved every second of this wonder.  The goal of the game is to take an adventure through the world of the condiment known as mayonnaise.  This jar of mayo and its stories are so life-changing that it might just make you haters of mayonnaise think twice, and put this substance onto your next meal.  

Truly a wonderful masterpiece.  10/10 would recommend

author: {'steamid': '76561198059769762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 46, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1466246036}
review: Do you like to click for no reason at all?   Sure, you can read the storylines of this game, but who really cares?   Stripped down to its bare basics, it's about tapping a jar of mayo with your finger endlessly.  Forget end goals, there is only tapping.  You don't tap up, tap down, or tap out.  You merely become one with the tap. Clear your mind, your soul, your consciousness.  Become the finger, become the mayo, become the clink clink clink clink clink.  Even now, I realize typing this is useless and takes me away from tapping that jar of mayo.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006541362', 'num_games_owned': 2760, 'num_reviews': 237, 'playtime_forever': 53, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 53, 'last_played': 1455947541}
review:
Trying something new in the clicker game genre ins't easy, My Name is Mayo does so by giving you tiered achievements tied to a few different story bits or random fun facts and different "dresses" for your clickable jar of mayo.
Yet for all its trying the game doesn't stray too far from others and is, at most, a brief and forgettable distraction.

[b]PROS:[/b]

-the various story bits and random facts are somewhat interesting

-some of the mayo dressups are quite funny

[b]NEUTRAL:[/b]

-very easy to 100%

[b]CONS:[/b]

-once you're done with the story bits the last achievements require a few thousands dull clicks

-very short

-price tags on clicker games are always a bit of a gamble, and this one doesn't do much to justify it

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=630962295

Just as you start having fun with My Name is Mayo the game is basically over as after about 4k clicks you'll have seen all the random facts, story bits and mayo types: the rest of the game will require you to click a few thousand more times with little to show for it and you might aswell just macro it. 

Even the funny bits are quite forgettable though and in fact the game doesn't do too much to stand out from other (and better) clicker games: it was gifted to me as a way to cheer up after a bad day (and it worked <3) and it is indeed a funny timewaster but it can't be considered much more.

Nothing really stands out enough for the game to justify even the very low price tag imho: sure there's some fun to be had and it's an easy 100% (if that matters to you) but it's overall too simple and forgettable to earn a recommendation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005104575', 'num_games_owned': 567, 'num_reviews': 33, 'playtime_forever': 55, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 55, 'last_played': 1456229095}
review:
[b]2/10[/b] - Barely worth it, even on sale. Sorry!

You get an hour - at max - out of your dollar spend, which is good, but it comes with a lot of but's...
[b]1st... ,but[/b] it has no replayability at all. Once you're done there's no point in coming back.
[b]2nd... ,but[/b] it fails at being humorous, although it trys to be. Maybe it's just not my sense of humor, but this game barely manages to be funny in any way.
[b]3rd... ,but[/b] there is barely any gameplay. You just click about 15k times, and thats it - you beat the game. No upgrades, no stages, kinda no progression. No depth at at all. Its just very flat...

[b]4th... ,but[/b] it's kind of worth it, in case you're in for the achievments. Well it's a quick and easy 100%-game to add to your stats and the achievments are actually the interesting part of the game, since they are the only thing well designed in that game.

[b]Overall[/b] i can't recommend this game to anyone, who's not looking for an addition to their achievment stats. It just isn't a game at all. Its a demo at max.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997578873', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 85, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 85, 'last_played': 1456161162}
review:
A friend of mine bought me, and some of his other friends, this "game" just for the heck of it. 98% of my enjoyment in this game was listening to all of us (in a 3rd party voice chat server) shouting out every 5 seconds about which achievements we were getting.  The remaining 2% comes from the actual game itself.

This is one of those games that's essentially played by repeatedly clicking your mouse. That's it.  You don't have to move your mouse, aim your mouse, slide your mouse. You just click. A LOT.  How much?  Well, if you play it right and progress through the "story" and get all the achievements, you can finish the game in 10,000 clicks. Yeah, there's an achievement for clicking your mouse 10,000 times.  One would hope that this would be your second to last achievement. The final achievement is... Getting All The Achievements.

I think my friend bought me this game because he is studing to be a doctor with a specialization in Carpal Tunnel Syndrome.

author: {'steamid': '76561198024968498', 'num_games_owned': 10778, 'num_reviews': 116, 'playtime_forever': 96, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1458640809}
review:
A clicker game in a nutshell. Click, get achievements, click more and eventually that mayo jar will open. 50 achievements, trading cards, a few short stories, 10 000 clicks, trading cards and broken mouse button. Did I forgot to mention trading cards?

I have to admit that I clicked it  ~1500 times and then got bored and switched to my broken mouse which registers much more clicks than I actually do.

What am I doing with my life?
Mayo/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198001774632', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 109, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 98, 'last_played': 1527523339}
review:
In this game you click a jar of mayo a lot of times and on the way you earn achievements and watch the jar of mayo in a few different outfits and scenarios.

The game itself isn't very technically impressive. But I guess you could say that about a lot of games nowadays.

Sure, you could have a little bit of fun with this as a meme thing, but as a game it's not something I'd recommend to anyone.

author: {'steamid': '76561198064749428', 'num_games_owned': 156, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 18, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 18, 'last_played': 1456129484}
review:
What do we do now?
Have you ever been stuck in life, feeling scared to do anything because you're afraid of failing? And when you know you have to do something but instead of doing something, you keep asking yourself "What do I do now?".

Well first of all, you should feel scared of failing, failing is scary and it's devastating. But that's normal, everyone feels like that. 
Secondly, you shouldn't keep problems to yourself, it's just like math, more people you share it with the less hard it will be. 

Sharing success with others is easy, but sharing failure and asking for a hand is not so easy. You probably feel uncomfortable showing negative emotions to others, most people keeps them to themselves and only try to show the positive part. I mean why would you burden someone with your problems? But sometimes a problem is too much to handle by yourself and when you are faced with that kind of a problem, talk to someone. And when you see someone with that kind of a problem, don't step away from it. Even if you're uncomfortable, go talk to them.

Now you know what to do when faced with a problem, but how do you start? Well "My Name is Mayo" is a game that explores the habit of hiding one's self to others. And hopefully this game will encourage you to be more open about yourself.

"My Name is Mayo" -just like it's strange title- is kind of a strange game. You start with an ordinary jar of mayonnaise, and as you progress through the game you will unlock stories of the ordinary jar of mayonnaise. 
At first glance, these stories seems like nothing but a joke, at first glance this whole game looks like nothing but a joke.
But after completing the first playthrough and you take a second look into each story, you will see that this game is far from just a joke.
There are four stories of [url=http://i.imgur.com/WoP2L8S.jpg]Mayo[/url], four very different kind of stories(which I wouldn't go into much detail about, because unlocking the next part of each story is something you should experience for yourselves). All four stories deal with the same idea, that we should be more open to others. Whether it's in a relationship, with your parents or with your friends, you should always feel comfortable sharing. 
As seen in each story, not being open to others have consenquences. You might break up, you might get into fights or you might lose someone important to you. 

So why keep a problem to yourself? You gain nothing from it, and you won't lose anything from sharing it. After you played through this game you'll know, whenever you ask yourself the question "What do I do now?" just open yourself to others, open a jar of mayonnaise.

author: {'steamid': '76561198056274794', 'num_games_owned': 159, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 23, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 22, 'last_played': 1470714365}
review: This is an amazing game, truly outrageous if i do say so myself. This game is an exciting sci-fi action horror rpg moba cross-over that made me cry everytime i played. If you decide to buy this game, whether it be for you or a friend, you won't end up regretting your purchase. This amazing game includes multiple choice influenced plots and over 950 hours of jaw-dropping, edge-of-the-sit, heart-warming gameplay. This game includes never before seen game mechanics that just tie so well with the theme of the game that it just makes you keep coming back for more. After the first time i played this game i had to un-install because my motor skills weren't mechanically ready for the expert level challenges that is My Name is Mayo. It took me 72 hours of non-stop training to comeback and feel like i was up to par with this game. I would rate this game 9/10 because of the the voice acting, but don't let the voice acting keep you from playing this game because the awe-inspiring graphics make up for them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198022188203', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 30, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 30, 'last_played': 1456117791}
review:
This is a game about tapping on a jar of mayonnaise. Sometimes if you tap on it enough it will share trivia with you or tell you stories.

That's pretty much it. That's the whole game.

And it's actually...way more addictive than it sounds.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053208728', 'num_games_owned': 873, 'num_reviews': 57, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1481617762}
review:
I didn't expect anything from this game; it had memes in the tags and its a clicker about... mayonaise. Seemed like Pewdiepiebait when I first saw it.

But I would say this game is definitely worth a dollar or sixty five cents on sale. I thought this game was really charming with it's odd little story. The gameplay is essentially just "mash left mouse and space bar until you damage your tendons", but there area several little chunks of story that you unlock as you click along.

It's a fun, quirky little game that I had a good time with

author: {'steamid': '76561198027598400', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 46, 'playtime_forever': 16, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 11, 'last_played': 1562738408}
review:
This game is a prime example of what a great year 2016 will be for the Video Game Industry. My Name is Mayo brings a revolutionary game to the table, a game that immerses the player into the life of your not so average mayo jar. My Name is Mayo tells a touching story, a story that rivals the epics of Homer, it is deep, emotional, heartwarming, and a puts a genuine smile on your face. Now the gameplay of My Name is Mayo is where this game shines. You see by either hitting the space bar or by clicking on the jar, you progress in the game. You see what is great about this is that the game has no time limit, or speed at which it must be played. You are in control, you drive the bus here, YOU the player get to expeience this adventure by your rules! Now if this isn't convincing enough for you did I mention that this game has a beautiful soundtrack? The music in this game surpasses any great symphony or musical piece ever written. It puts Motzart to shame, Bach can't even begin to comprehend how amazing this musical masterpiece is. Now if you aren't convinced of this game's amazing value by now then frankly you shouldn't even be allowed to use a computer anymore, because obviously you can't comprehend how amazing this game is, but if you still aren't convinced then let me tell you one last thing to change your mind. This game has achievements! Yes! Achievements! And these achievements not only make you feel really good, but you can show them off to your friends too! Trust me, Billy down the street won't be the cool kid anymore once you stroll in with your big list of achievements, not only that you can whip out that handy dandy smartphone or laptop of yours and show everybody that you're on the top of those world leaderboards for number of clicks. So you may ask, "Wow this game is amazing, there's got to be some catch" or "There's got to be one bad thing about this game right?" NOPE! My Name is Mayo is flawless, utter coding perfection. I mean come on, Fallout 4 on release had so many bugs the damn game was unplayable, but My Name is Mayo? Nope, no bugs here, 100% bug free since launch day. And the graphics? Well, My Name is Mayo takes complete advantage of your PC's advanced and powerful processors and video cards, it has zero restrictions whatsoever. No capping at 30fps to fit those console peasants, My Name is Mayo is 100% PC Master Race compatable. My Name is Mayo will change your life, are you single? Show a girl (or a boy) your high score and we'll see how "single" you are then. Failing math class at school? Play this and you'll learn advanced math with no problems. Are you overweight and want to drop a few pounds? Play this and your constant clicking will burn through that fat in no time. And best of all, you get this masterpice of a game for only $0.99! I'm telling you people, once we make contact with alien life, this is the game we'll show them to prove how advanced we are. NASA uses this game to help train their astronauts, seriously, it's that good! Tai Lopez himself uses this game, without this game he would have no knowledge, and with no knowledge there would be no garage, and with no garage there would be no fuel units, and then where would we be? My Name is Mayo GIVE YOU KNOWLEDGE. KNOWLEDGE.
So what are you waiting for? Don't stare at your computer screen like a moron, Buy this game now!

review:
My lifelong dream of seeing Mayonnaise in different bikinis is now achieved. Thank you creators. 
However, after completing all achievements of this game, I still had to look up how to spell mayonnaise. 

Story was entertaining, though the last fact is a scam: it's not a fact. BLASPHEMY.
Hint: Hit space bar and click your mouse... it speeds things up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197994682977', 'num_games_owned': 849, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 41, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1576278716}
review:
As a fan of clickers, I guess I was expecting something more. The entire game depends on "Lol SO Randomz" humour. While initially amusing, a few hundred clicks in it's already worn thin. 

47 of the 50 achievements are accomplished in about 5000 clicks. The remaining 3 are "Get 8000 clicks" "Get 10k clicks" and "Get all achievements." That's double the game's length in padding. 

Not many games can I say I paid $0.60 for and still feel if the expediture was questionable.
