author: {'steamid': '76561198059334708', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1456033594}
review:
My Name is Mayo isn't great.


I didn't expect much from this game, but for less than a dollar (when 40% off), I bought it hoping for an interesting game with a fairly good story. Unfortunately all I got was half of an interesting game without a good story. The game did make me laugh at some points with it's strange visuals, but the good story I was hoping for? Nothing. All I got was a silly, forgetable bunch of nonsensical stories that didn't intrest me in any way. I think the reason why I feel this way is because I couldn't connect with the character.


In a game about clicking a jar of mayonaise, I found it difficult to conect to the main character, Mayo.


It may sound strange, but have you ever played a story game for the gameplay? I'm sure about 85% of you will say no, you play a story game for the interesting and memorable characters, for the detailed plot. A plot about a horny, philosophical jar of mayo? No. A plot about a criminal named Larson Hoover who discovers he has lung cancer, so he spends the his last 8 months trying to right his wrongs and reconnect with his family? Yes. That's what My Name is Mayo was lacking, a good story.  Does Mayo have a family? Does Mayo have an occupation? Does Mayo have a secret? Nah, he/she/it's just an admirer of bikinis and a nut for philosophy.


So that's my thoughts of My Name is Mayo as a story game. what about as a clicker game?


Awful is the only way to describe it. It adds nothing new to the clicker games. I fact, It took away the only few things that made the clicker games good. All you do in My Name is Mayo is click a jar of mayonaise, and that's it. There are no upgrades, no temporary power-ups, and nothing changes. A good example is Cookie Clicker. For those of you that have played the game, you have probably discovered the "grandma incident". I remember when I got to that moment, all I could say is, "Holy ####, what the #### is going on!?" In My Name is Mayo, nothing like that happens. You just click away and get frequent hand cramps with no changes in gameplay whatsoever. It's boring.


So after ######## about all the bad things, because I'm a glass half empty kind of guy, lets talk about some of the good things My Name is Mayo has to offer.


The game isn't so bad that I want to lock myself in a glass box in front of a kindergarteners and suffocate to death. The visuals and story gave me a small chuckle every now and then and the random facts were fun to read. And I rememer marveling at the amount of time people put into this game to get on top of the mayo clicking leaderboard. That was fun. And... um............ yeah, don't buy this game. Get a gumball with your dollar or something. This game will leave you feeling robbed and unsatisfied.

author: {'steamid': '76561198042798748', 'num_games_owned': 84, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 204, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 204, 'last_played': 1456030738}
review:
For less than a dollar, I wouldn't even mind paying this for that amount of price.

[h1]The Basics?[/h1]
Well, it's nothing more than a clicking clicker adventure, except more entertaining with 50 easy achievements that provides you a random fact or you can have 4 different stories being told.

[h1]Basic summaries from the four stories:[/h1]
[olist]
    [*]Love/Sex Story
    [*]What's Life? Story
    [*]Relationship between a Mayo and someone Story (It's rather depressing...)
    [*]Dreaming Career Story
[/olist]

As you progress with the stories and achievements, the Mayo Jar will change outfits depending on the story that's being told. (*Ahem* emphasis on the Love/Sex Story)

Depending your pace, it may take you less than an hour or two or maybe even more when trying to get the card drops. Honestly, even without an autoclicker, it shouldn't take you [b]that[/b] long.

[h1]But once you get all the achievements, what else is there to do?[/h1]
You can keep going, clicking on your merry way, replay the stories, but there really isn't much to it afterwards.

In conclusion, it's an enjoyable experience. The entertaining stories make up the small price.
[spoiler]Oh, and you might get a mayo fetish after clicking it so many times for so long. ;)[/spoiler]

[i]What do we do now?
(The End)[/i]

[h1]Should you buy this "clicker of a game?"[/h1]
Honestly, it's your choice. Are you willing to pay about a dollar for a decent clicking experience? Want more trading cards for badge crafting? Then this is for you.
7.5/10

review:
Once you realize the story, you've gone too far.
Beating this game takes time! SKILL!

author: {'steamid': '76561198112866114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 330, 'playtime_forever': 76, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 76, 'last_played': 1568892293}
review:
The whole objective of this game is to click on a mayo jar 10,000 times. Seriously that's it. There is nothing else to do other than that. Click the same spot 10,000 times on a completely stationary mayo jar. What happens at the end once you have clicked on the mayo jar 10,000 times? The lid comes off and a title says 'open yourself to others just like you have opened this mayo jar'... What the hell does that mean? Does the developer want me to go around touching people 10,000 times? 

If at the end of the game the title would have been the developers address so that I could drive myself around to his house and hit him over his noggin with a police baton 10,000 times I might have given this game a thumbs up, but alas it doesn't. I hit the thumbs down button for this one 10,000 times and maybe even the middle finger button which steam hasn't added yet...

Sample below from Jim Sterling...

https://youtu.be/_OoXfp9cUdU

If you enjoyed reading this review please subscribe to my curator page. Thanks...

http://store.steampowered.com/curator/6843548/

author: {'steamid': '76561197963550511', 'num_games_owned': 26600, 'num_reviews': 272, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 71, 'last_played': 1469399171}
review:
For a bunch of cents and some optional carpal tunnel injuries, you can +1 your 100%'d Steam games while reading through a mildly entertaining story. By removing nonlinear progression system and resets, the clicker genre is streamlined down to the simple act of clicking. Depending on how jolly your hands are, this will take an hour of actual clicking, or two if you're a slowpoke. For about half the clicks you're treated to the game's writing and frequent fresh & reasonably novel mayonnaise targets.

My wrist started moaning after the first 2000 clicks; the next 3000 to the end of the story content I alternated between carpal exercises and further clicking. For the last grind, I turned on autoclicking software and walked off.

author: {'steamid': '76561198081430111', 'num_games_owned': 2542, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 48, 'last_played': 1455930807}
review:
I just beat this game in it's entirety in the last half hour. My finger hurts, but I don't regret it. My Name is Mayo is a completionist's wet dream, but it's also decently entertaining.

.Premise.
This game is about a jar of mayo, as you're likely aware. The "story" is presented in a series of unlockable achievements, both in game and out, and there are a handful of different ones to click through. Fulfilling the clicking requirements for one 

.Game play.
Click. Click for your life. You can cycle through the achievements in order to get more achievements, which also result in a Mayo costume change. Then you click some more. Both the costumes and the story itself are funny for their shock value and off the wall...ness. 

.Soundtrack.
Eh... I didn't pay too much attention to it over the 'clink, clink' of tapping against a simulated glass jar.

.Graphics.
It kind of looks hand-painted, which is nice. And a few of the props actually moved around. 

.Price.
For a game with absolutely no longevity, I'd say I can't complain about the $0.59 price tag at launch. 1.00USD is a little steep, but that's up to you.

Bottom line: it's amusing and clever and I'd love to see a less casual game from the developers. Definitely worth a look if you have some time to kill. When else are you going to see Mayo in such a sexy state?

My only complaint is that I ran out of funny story achievements and costume changes at around 5000 clicks, which left a solid 5000 clicks for completion without any added silliness.

author: {'steamid': '76561198048842929', 'num_games_owned': 2402, 'num_reviews': 463, 'playtime_forever': 240, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 183, 'last_played': 1456081150}
review:
Bei der Installationsangabe wurden 17 MB angezeigt, aber nur 11,9 MB wurden runtergeladen.

Also auch Leute die im Wald leben und kein DSL, ja noch nicht mal ISDN haben, falls es sowas noch geben sollte, k√∂nnten sich das Game runterladen.

Jetzt zum eigentlichen Game! Viele schreiben, dass man hier nur etwas rumklicken muss und dann einen Haufen Errungenschaften und ein perfektes Game bekommt. Aber stimmt das wirklich? Wir werden sehen.

Sehr ausf√ºhrliche Gamebeschreibung: Man startet das Game und sieht ein Mayoglas, mit einem Rotem Decken. Man steuert eine Hand und wenn man auf das Majoglas klickt, dann wird das gez√§hlt und in der rechten oberen Ecke festgehalten. Bei bestimmten Punktzahlen bekommt man eine Errungenschaft. Wenn man das Game beendet und irgendwann wieder startet, dann spielt man da wo man aufgeh√∂rt hatte weiter, also Punktzahlenm√§√üig. Und es gibt noch eine globale Bestenliste, von der ich nichts halte, da alles erschwindelt aussieht.  Das wars. Das ist das ganze Game. Ich glaube ausf√ºhrlicher kann man es nicht beschreiben^^

Ich vermute ein Mensch hat das Game an einem Wochenende im Alleingang entwickelt. Wenn er mit Steam einen guten Deal gemacht hat, ist er vielleicht jetzt ein Million√§r. Auch wenn das Game regul√§r 99 Cent und im Sale noch weniger einbringt! Denn hier z√§hlt die Masse der K√§ufe, die von errungenschaftsgeilen ‚ÄûGamern‚Äú erbracht wurde.

Pers√∂nliche Erfahrung:
F√ºr mich selber war es nicht so leicht die ganzen Errungenschaften zu bekommen. Dieses Bild mit dem Majoglas brannte sich in meine Augen. Tr√§nen liefen, ich hatte das Bed√ºrfnis mir meine Augen auszustechen. Dieses eint√∂nige Lied! Das werde ich nie mehr vergessen! Jeden Moment h√§tte mein Trommelfell platzen k√∂nnen. Ich brenne, Obdachlose versuchen mich zu l√∂schen, indem sie auf mich pissen! Ich rollte mich zur Seite um zu sterben. Ich wache nassgeschwitzt auf, danke Gott den Allm√§chtigen unseren Sch√∂pfer, dass es nur ein Albtraum war. Nichtsdestotrotz hatte ich den Wunsch jeden zu t√∂ten, der eine majofarbene Bekleidung mit einer roten M√ºtze an hatte.

PS: Es gibt auch Sammelkarten

Wenn Euch das Review gefallen hatte, dann bedankt Euch bei R4LL3, denn durch seine Review bin ich zu diesem Game gekommen. Wenn ihr ihn noch nicht kennt, sein Profilbild sieht aus als wenn er kurz davor stehen w√ºrde euch das Gesicht zu zerschlagen. Ich wei√ü, Profilbilder sagen nichts √ºber die tats√§chliche Person aus! Vielleicht ist er auch ein kleines folgsames M√§dchen, eine kleine Prinzessin mit Zahnspange. Er k√∂nnte aber auch ein knallharter Hardcoretyp sein. Zollt ihm also Respekt!

Diese Review wurde nach f√ºnf Bier verfasst. Rechtschreibfehler sind m√∂glich, sogar wahrscheinlich. Das schreibe ich nur, weil ich keine Lust habe mir den Wisch nochmal durchzulesen. OK ich bin auch wirklich etwas besoffen :D

author: {'steamid': '76561198078519628', 'num_games_owned': 1567, 'num_reviews': 169, 'playtime_forever': 43, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1455922389}
review:
So....This is a game....Where you click a jar of mayo. It's all you do. You ocassionally unlock new "outfits" for your jar of mayo. (I dare to say, some of them are sexy. What am I doing with my life?)
It's one of those clicker games, but this one is as cynical as it gets. 

It's all there's to it. If you want an "easy" perfect game (It's easy to get all the achievements, but it's quite tedious. You need to click around 10,000. I wouldn't waste my precious mouse with this, so I used scripts.)

Click click click, unlock new outfits, keep clicking, and sooner or later, you'll get a perfect game and you can finally get rid of this game forever. I wouldn't recommend it at all, I went through it with scripts and I still feel like killing myself. You  could gift this to somebody if you want them to question life and hate themselves.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006298956', 'num_games_owned': 1118, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 134, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1457112108}
review:
You are a hand, floating in an unknown void. The stars align and your path crosses with that of Mayo. Mayo will enthrall you with tales of its life, it will make you think with philosphy, it will try to arouse your most carnal instincts. 

Nah, I'm just screwing with you. You just tap on a mayo jar. Sometimes you can put silly things on it, like bikinis. There are puns. That's about it. 

What you have to ask yourself is: Do you like clicking on condiments more than you like dropping 59 pennies and deciding not to waste the effort to bend down and pick them up? I recommend it because I'm bad with money.

author: {'steamid': '76561198115158556', 'num_games_owned': 1402, 'num_reviews': 392, 'playtime_forever': 208, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1455858937}
review:
5.9/10 - If you didn't know... Clicking 10,000 times takes about an hour!

I didn't know what to expect with this game; it's my kind of dumb though! This is basically just a fun clicking competition between friends. I love seeing the number of clicks from my friends; I'm currently sitting #2 with 12,200 clicks and will surpass them all. Maybe‚Ä¶

This is one of the easiest games to complete with 100% achievements. Worth the $0.99 if you are searching for those; otherwise only play if you are into clicking competitions. 

Worth $0.59-0.99 for achievements and a wrist workout!

author: {'steamid': '76561198091682523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 45, 'playtime_forever': 59, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 12, 'last_played': 1502963384}
review: Okay for 0.59 cents (original price 0.99) its not a bad price. I mean basically if you love clicking games and are addicted to them as I am, then this is a game for you! Just continous clicking. Click the achivments you get to get a "storymode" and unlock "outfits" I had fun with and its an achivment game. If you also love getting achivments like I do THIS TOO IS THE GAME FOR YOU!! XD

author: {'steamid': '76561198040299836', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2913, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2342, 'last_played': 1554432058}
review: For a game that I bought for 59 cents (12 cents out of my own wallet to be honest. The rest was paid for garbage I sold off my steam inventory), it is quite an alright game. I'm still trying to reach the end boss but 48 hours in and there's no end in sight. I've given up on getting some achievments, I just like the appeal of the "Best Deal/ Top Seller" skin so I just use that. I heard there was going to be sequel with Ketchup and Mustard characters but I'm not sure. But yeah give this game a try it's not that bad.

review:
"Mein Arm tut weh, aber das wars wert! Noch nie war ein Glas Mayonnaise so interessant." DerGrueneShawn 2016 ~

Story:
Ein Glas Mayonnaise auf seinem steinigen Weg, seine wahre Identit√§t zu finden. Lustig, herzzerreisend und renomierte Bollywoodregisseure arbeiten grade schon auf Hochtouren an einem Drehbuch.

Gameplay.
KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK KLICK

Pr√§sentation:
Ein Glas Mayonnaise, eine Hand, viele skurrile Situationen und Errungenschaften, was will man mehr?

Fazit: 
Ich habe in 36 Minuten 10000 mal geklickt, gelacht, geweint, okay nicht geweint, aber zumindest ein bisschen gelitten, vor allem, weil das echt auf die Arme geht, wenn man nicht schummelt und WIRKLICH nur klickt und habe das Spiel somit schneller beendet, als dass alle 3 Kartenfunde ausgel√∂st wurden. Ein kurzweiliges Erlebnis, das einige Kalorien verbrennt und in keiner K√ºche ... Steambibliothek fehlen sollte ~

author: {'steamid': '76561197975831685', 'num_games_owned': 9454, 'num_reviews': 104, 'playtime_forever': 164, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 164, 'last_played': 1455970852}
review:
47 pence for just over an hours entertainment.
Couldn't buy a real jar of mayo for that, and this is healthier.
Built up my finger muscles no end.
Achievements have a plot of sorts and you will get a lot more from this than tapping a real mayo jar.
Take it for what it is and you won't be disappointed.

Mayo as well give it a thumbs up.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983082568', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 263, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 261, 'last_played': 1490055000}
review:
My Name is Mayo
Score: 7.5 / 10

Instructions: 
1. Pick a story Arc
2. Stick your finger on the Mayonnaise Jar
3. Auto click until the Achievement appears
4. If Total Achievements = 50 then End
5. Otherwise goto 1.

This was fun for just 1 hour and 10 000 ‚Äòclicks‚Äô. Upbeat music in that 1950s cartoon orchestral style accompanies a Jar of Mayonnaise in 4 coming of age stories. 

The novelty factor has worn off and I am not certain that I would buy another ‚Äòclicker‚Äô game. Did someone say this should have been free?

secret music hack: 
If you go into your \steamapps\common\My name is Mayo\ windows\
Find the file called snd_main.ogg and replace the file with any music file you have in .ogg format. 
You have to rename your music file to snd_main.ogg! 
Then boot the game and you can click away to your favorite song !

Buy "My Name is Mayo" if you collect ‚Äòclicker‚Äô games, if you really need those 50 Achievements, or if you just need to own at least one ‚Äòclicker‚Äô game.

[u]My scoring system 7.5 / 10[/u]
10 / exemplary execution of the genre with compelling innovation
9 / exemplary execution of the genre don‚Äôt miss out, for fans of the genre and the curious alike
[u]8 / for well done not a must play, fans of the genre and newbs will be happy it is well done 
7 / for calibrated expectations only, fans of the genre would not miss out if they skipped this [/u]
6 / only for serious fans of the genre for whom game play with bugs is acceptable
5 / enough bugs to make me unhappy

review:
My Name is Mayo is a Clicking Adventure with a nice little Story. 
The most Graphic you will see is a Mayo Glass, sometimes this view will change when you make a Quest. The Sound is minimalistic and ok for the Game.

The really best on that Game is the Goal of total Archivements under 1 Hour of Playtime and the surrealistic Mayo Art Style.

My Name is Mayo is a little fresh and minimalistic Story Clicker and for that pleasant price you can buy it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198185171215', 'num_games_owned': 1043, 'num_reviews': 38, 'playtime_forever': 1037, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1455778433}
review:
This game is very short, you can perfect your achievement in 50 minutes. It's more like an achievement simulator on a clicker game with a few story to follow until the end. And I'm not going to write serious review this about game, you just can buy and try it yourself.

I'll prefer tell you another story about Mayo, and here it is ...

I have real life friend named Mayo, he like mayonnaise.
And it will be better when he played this game than me.
Because my name is not Mayo, and I don't like mayonnaise.

Someday, if he played this game he will be happy and shout loudly and sing like these ...

" May I have your attention please?
May I have your attention please?
Will the real Mayo please stand up?
I repeat, will the real Mayo please stand up?
We're gonna have a problem here..

Anyone ?
No... ?

'Cause I'm Mayo, yes I'm the real Mayo
All you other Mayos are just imitating
So won't the real Mayo please stand up,
Please stand up, please stand up?

'Cause My Name is... (what?) My name is... (who?)
My name is... Mayo ! "

10/10 would not imitating Mayo and click the jar under his name again.

review: I'm going to be completely honest. It's a $.59 game. You could buy chewing gum for the same price. I 'm not rating this game as some sort of magnum opus, I'm just rating it's entertainment value. This game is a gag game. No one would buy a game about tapping mayonaise for it's story. You're tapping Mayonaise! So, I'll say that I reccomend it. I believe that the gags are pretty funny and I love getting 50 extra acheivements. Don't expect much, but it is kinda funny, so yeah.

review:
This is one of the most compelling games I have played in 2016 so far. 

Story:
The storyline is great, i'm not gonna spoil it, but it's just amazing.

Gameplay:
The gameplay involved tapping a jar of mayo. This is one of the most innovating types of gameplay I have seen in a very long time.


I would really recommend this game to people whom would want a compwlling story,great gameplay, and an overall good game. 11/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198030494571', 'num_games_owned': 2476, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1455755426}
review:
Very simple and fun clicking game. Story is done through the achievments which you can select through a menu. I had to alt-enter the game to put it in window mode since alt-tab would seem to crash it. That also fixed my second monitor from flickering.

Overall a creative and fun game.

**POTENTIAL SPOILERS**
I also believe the story revolves around you trying to get a mayo jar open. While you are trying to open it you are remembering when you had to try and get previous mayo jars open throughout your life. You also start to remember other difficult condiments like ketchup. After a long struggle, you are finally able to open it however.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aYwuRFTRzYc

author: {'steamid': '76561198052019561', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 61, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1458028177}
review: You've already played this game by clicking on this review, actually by clicking on anything at all.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053122420', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1455754191}
review:
I don't even know where to begin praising this masterpiece:

Firstly, this game has some fantastic graphics which put its competitors such as GTA 5 and Fallout 4 to shame. The pure detail in the jar of mayonnaise almost made me cry tears of joy, because it reflects how far we have come as a species.

Secondly, the story in this game is second to none, I found myself unable to stop playing due to the fact that the story in this game had me on the edge of my seat the whole time and the ending was so clever and meaningful that I find myself re-thinking my life.

For just 47p you can enjoy the finest ever graphics and a story deeper than Jaden Smith's Twitter. You must be thinking at this point, well whats the catch? There really is none, go and buy this game and recommend it to your friends. 

I can't imagine what my life was before playing this, I really can't.

10/10

review:
My name is Mayo gaat over een pot mayo, je moet klickspammen op de pot om punten te scoren.
Het enige wat je moet doen:
Klikken, achievements aanklikken, klikken (ook met spatie kan je klikken) en het verhaal van Mayo volgen tot je alle achievements hebt gehaald.
Het spel duurd ongeveer een half uur, daarna kan je hem refunden. Of als je de ontwikkelaars toch je geld gund, houden.

review:
This game is innovation at its finest!


In all seriousnes though, I picked up this game for 47p and attained 100% completion in one sitting of 0.8 hours. The game obviously has steam achievements and trading cards which make it more of a collectors game but anyone can enjoy this with its cheesy gameplay and humerous short story lines. However I speak the truth when I say I'm writing with review with my index finger in pain...

author: {'steamid': '76561198012898143', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 243, 'last_played': 1455746099}
review:
0,59‚Ç¨ basically wasted but in a funny way: funny stories and a lot of stupid comics. The main con is that its pretty useless apart from giving you some easy achievements and cards. You could basically win this by activating the autoclicker.
A big pro is the ending sentence: open yourself to others... Just like you opened this jar of mayo! Great sentence, full of meaning even if presented in a silly way.
Plus, i love mayonnaise. Everyone does, even my brother (who says he doesnt... but who doesnt like mayo?!?).

author: {'steamid': '76561197974248145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 67, 'playtime_forever': 137, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1544475958}
review:
My name is Mayo, is not really a videogame, it's just a clicker game more suited to being on mobile.
The game should have really been free as it's not worth anything.

The artwork is fairly good.

The rest of the "game" falls short, leaves much to be desired and isn't really worth playing/purchasing.

Overall I give this game a 1/10, it's almost as bad as bad rats, although it does look better and has nicer music.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020087176', 'num_games_owned': 905, 'num_reviews': 234, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 47, 'last_played': 1455426074}
review:
En 2014 el equipo costarricense de Green Lava Studios se hacia con el premio GameMaker Game of the Year 2014 gracias a su primera producci√≥n Fenix Rage, un juego de acci√≥n en plataformas en 2D que sorprender√≠a a propios y extra√±os con su din√°mica y alta dificultad que le llegar√≠a a catapultar como uno de los mejores juegos del E3 2014, t√≠tulo que ser√≠a reforzado con el GOTY antes mencionado que le abrir√≠a las puertas de la industria para proyectos m√°s osados.

Hoy, tras el √©xito alcanzado y su eminente llegada al mundo de las consolas, Green Lava Studios intentan dar la campanada con una propuesta distinta, m√°s relajada y con un humor especial bajo el nombre My Name is Mayo, un Clicker no tan Clicker que tuvimos la oportunidad de probar previo a su lanzamiento oficial. ¬øEstar√° a la altura de las expectativas? Veamos.

La vida de un tarro de mayonesa no es sencilla


Las penas de Mayo son muchas, desde un padre machista que nunca estuvo de acuerdo con su propia herencia hasta uno que otro destello fugaz de conocimiento celular. Con eventos catastr√≥ficos en la vida de Mayo que le llevaron a ser incluso una mayonesa ordinaria, empezaremos a entender que el juego no solo es un simple "clicker" y que a pesar del muy posible "what the hell?" inicial, le tomaremos cari√±o y nos sacar√° una que otra sonrisa con cada nuevo descubrimiento que logremos conforma avanza el juego. 

Con la simpleza que podr√≠a de primera entrada ofrece un t√≠tulo en el que -en teor√≠a-, s√≥lo tienes que hacer click hasta que te de un RSI de grado 3, My name is Mayo tiene su atractivo en lo il√≥gico de su propuesta , pues con cada click (o unos cientos) iremos desentra√±ando lo m√°s profundo de cada uno de los sentimientos de Mayo, aprendiendo sobre las aventuras y locuras que solo una mayonesa puede contar, y este podr√≠amos se√±alar es el principal punto que le aleja de otros juegos del g√©nero, ya que contra todos los pron√≥sticos iniciales al momento de su greenlight, la historia escondida en cada logro es su principal baluarte.


Made in Costa Rica desde 1949
Lo mismo que su apartado visual, que se convierte en uno de los puntos altos a destacar, con un arte bastante atractivo que se plasma, a trav√©s de los dibujados y acabados en cada una de las figuras que conforman el peque√±o escenario del juego, en una paleta colores con un acabado en oleo que le da cierto aire vintage a cada uno de los peque√±os a√±adidos cosm√©ticos o incluso de lencer√≠a que tendr√° Mayo, por lo que la experiencia visual en un juego de esta naturaleza est√° garantizada de principio a fin. 

Sobre su jugabilidad, es poco lo que podemos agregar a un t√≠tulo que su base en el g√©nero del clicker, por lo que tendremos que ir desbloqueando distintos logros que ir√°n revelando m√°s y m√°s historias sobre nuestra querida mayonesa "Made in Costa Rica", conociendo las distintas ocurrencias que tendr√° la protagonista de esta delirante historia, y que a los jugadores locales les esbozar√° m√°s de una sonrisa al obtener el logro "It was a stormy night and it was rainings cats and dogs", entre otros gui√±os a la cultura latina que para los jugadores de nuestra regi√≥n ser√°n de grata referencia. 



En los aspectos negativos, podemos se√±alar que de primera entrada no queda muy claro si los logros son desencadenados tras alguna cantidad ya predefinida de clicks o ya sea si estos 'saltan' al hacer click en una parte determinada de la pantalla, aunque conforme vamos avanzando en el juego descubrimos que la mec√°nica es la cantidad de clicks abren la opciones de trabajo y estos al desbloquearse nos dan acceso a la historia, algo que podr√≠a no ser de enganche para quienes inician en el juego, pero es parte de la apuesta de este g√©nero.

Al final queda la sensaci√≥n de que My name is Mayo es un clicker con mec√°nicas de logros bastante interesantes que a ratos funciona como experimento social, autoparodia del g√©nero o se√±alamiento directo a los t√≠tulos que abusan de los QTE's, pero al mismo tiempo da la idea de ser una obra con una propuesta menos compleja de lo que aparenta, por lo que sin dudas generar√° opiniones extremas -o lo amas o lo odias-, entre sus jugadores, siendo un t√≠tulo que tal vez no cale tan hondo en aquellos que pasen por alto las expectativas del g√©nero, o que al contrario, que encuentren en su base poco ortodoxa, una grata experiencia que les permita pasar un rato agradable -como lo hizo este servidor-, que recompense los miles de clicks que les espera en el camino.

author: {'steamid': '76561198107298618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1455724160}
review:
Kind of a stupid game, you click a jar, unlock costumes for your mayo jar along with achievemnts by clicking on it,and thats it... but getting all these achievements is satisfying, it is the kind of game I would expect to be free on the internet and not on steam for money.

The game is also quite short I finished it under an hour, I really don't know I would rate it "Meh" because there is really nothing amazing here but clicking mayo was more entertaining than some other Early access tat.

There is a 30 fps lock tho, I mean c'mon I want to experience such amazing gameplay at 60 fps

author: {'steamid': '76561198001046455', 'num_games_owned': 13201, 'num_reviews': 349, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 43, 'last_played': 1469923203}
review:
TL;DR: Only gameplay is poking (clicking) a mayonnaise jar. Is this art or junk?

It is unfair to regard [i]My Name is Mayo[/i] like a conventional game. Clearly it doesn't have gameplay as its main focus. It left me with a rather mixed feelings but having to choose, ultimately I'm leaning to the side of thumbs down.

Presented with a huge jar of Mayo (tm), you proceed to poke at it with the equally huge finger-shaped cursor. Click click click, poke poke poke. Is this supposed to be a thing? Since it's mostly sold in plastic tubes around here I don't have experience with real-life mayo jars.

There are no time limits nor arbitrary restrictions of other kinds: it's the epitome of casual.

[h1]Achievement unlocked![/h1]

It's basically an achievement dispenser. All cheevos have an in-game picture and associated text, which forms a short story or monologue, so they are integral to "the story". To see the whole story, highlighting the picture will add some detail into the mayo jar (like a bra or a simple curious animation) and story will proceed when you click it again a bunch.

Graphics are okay, music makes you hum along even if it's terribly repetitive. However, this extremely casual entertainment lasts only as long as it takes for you to click about 10000 times, so likely just 30 to 60 minutes. Leaderboards for the highest clickers is basically a tongue-in-cheek joke.

[h1]What's the point?[/h1]

So is it a good game? Definitely not. Is it fun or entertaining? Mildly. Is there a higher meaning to all of this? It is slightly thought-provoking to the point of being pointless. I am left with an irrational feeling of being mocked. Maybe that's the point. After all I just spent 45 minutes poking a mayonnaise jar.

To the very least it is really cheap and basically feeds you 50 "achievements" that for once don't feel like achievements.

Ceci n'est pas un jeu, juste une raison de plus √† votre tendinite de l'index de venir vous faire un coucou. 

En gros, 10.000 clicks et 50 succ√©s. voila √† quoi se limite ce "jeu". Un clicker game qui n'en est pas un, (car vous √™tes le seul √† cliquer) et qui n'offre aucune perspective supplementaire une fois les 10.000 coups de doigts donn√©s sur votre pot de mayo.

Pour les succ√®s, n'oubliez pas de visiter votre menu des achievments afin de selectionner certains d'entre eux (pour d√©bloquer les suivants) sinon vous d√©passerez les 10.000 et meriterez bel et bien votre tendinite.

A PRENDRE UNIQUEMENT POUR LES CHASSEURS DE SUCCES ET MAYO-MANIAQUES. Les autres, vous le regretterez surement ...

author: {'steamid': '76561197970644409', 'num_games_owned': 6460, 'num_reviews': 130, 'playtime_forever': 229, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 229, 'last_played': 1455771473}
review:
[H1]50 Achievements in 50 minutes[/H1]

The music is nice, bit like that game where you burn things.
You can complete this in 45 minutes. WIthout a clicker helper that is.
It is cheap.
It is small.

You get lots of achievements, and a fairy easy 100%. Recommended because it tells you how utterly useless and pointless achievements actually [i]can be[/i]. And how abusive the system is. If this game didn't have them, the game would be totally useless. So it actually is just a joke to teach us something (?). Perhaps.

I got my 50 and 100% and a sour wrist. Moving along...

author: {'steamid': '76561198011224821', 'num_games_owned': 295, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 24, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1455585104}
review:
This Game was ridiculous. Had me on the edge of my seat at every moment. With a Gripping Storyline which resembles a mass effect meets Robert kirkman esqe deal, you will be enthraled and overjoyed at every moment. Watch as you and your other condiments (Ketchup, Mustard...no spoilers..) take on the "galactic fridge". A large empire of other foods whom use the dark side of "the fork". This empire seeks to bring mold to all foods in the kitchen. You play as Mayo, a strapping young condiment who doesnt realize he has the power of the fork. The Story of the game is good, (I dont want to give away to much), but the game really strides with its combat. A reverse third person system almost like CS GO but also nothing like it. I can see 2 more sequels in the future, then 3 horrid prequels, then in like 30 years I can see it being bought by a huge company known for kids stuff and 3 more sequels being squeezed out. Its really a great game 10/10 would totally recommend to a sloth with thumbs.

SPOILER ALERT** Hot Sauce Solo Dies.... 






PSA: Obviously this is fake, its a game about clicking a jar of mayo, literally thats it, i bought it for $0.59 I wasnt expecting GTA 6. Its weird an I like the easy achievements so yeah buy it, like its the price of a gumball.

author: {'steamid': '76561198025042250', 'num_games_owned': 346, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1482941690}
review:
A friend bought me this game as a joke, having no idea what it was before hand. My first reaction was 'is this I am Bread 2'? But I could not have been more wrong. Upon opening the game I will admit that I was not impressed. "It's just a jar of mayo," I recall myself saying, "There's not even a main menu." But I soon realized that there wasn't any need for that. The game in itself was all it needed. What followed was, in my experience, was a few minutes of me clicking on the jar as I figured out the various achievements I could get while said friend watched on my broadcast. 

Within ten minutes I was dressing up my mayoanaise jar. Within twenty I had unlocked all of the achievements other than the ones to do with click number. And that's where my story began, the true journey of self discovery. As my friend laughed, I continued to play and click until my muscles hurt and it felt like my finger would fall off. But I was determined. I watched the number rise. 5000... 6000... and so on until I finally hit that glorious number.

10000

And what I realized about myself changed my view on the world completely. If I hadn't given this game a chance, I wouldn't have these precious memories. And so, I say, give things a try even when you're hesitant to. Or be like me and be addicted to clicker games.

Still better than sakura clicker/10

review:
MNIM is an utterly pointless clicker game. The only objective is to click an object 10,000 timrd while unlocking 50 achievements along the way. Depending on how fast you can click, you'll be done well within an hour and regretting ever wasting your time (and money!) on this pile of tosh. There is nothing redeemable about this game whatsoever.

I would rather eat a real jar of mayonnaise than ever play this game again.

Oh. Wait. I did.

review:
Playthrough: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NoYIWSS2L0E

This Game Is Stupid.

There I said it, but it's not the bad kind of stupid it's the stupid that makes you face palm and roll your eyes while you quietly respect its awesomeness, pretty much like all my jokes.

If you bought this game chances are you just did it with money made from selling your Tec9 Sandstorm or huge amount of crates you can't afford to open in TF2, even if you didn't think about the positive! You now a mayo jar to click.... Cause that's all it is!

My Name Is Mayo? More Like My Name Is Amazing.... in bed ;) Cause the forearm workout this thing gives you from 10,000 clicks will make your girlfriend appreciate your spending habits! 

So What are you waiting for? Seriously what? You can't tell me you don't have some random amount of cash sitting up there from a previous purchase that you don't want to get rid of, if its a yes BUY THIS GAME

If its a no, BUY THIS GAME!

Happy Clicking my fellow Champions of the Matress

As you play you delve further into the enigma of what was once a simple condiment, you learn there's more than meets the eye with it's deep intricate mixtures of egg oil and vinegar, jarred for your enjoyment.
Truely it is a diamond in the rough that needs a nice tap n try

All other critics are simply sell outs from gameinformer attempting to hide true glory from the starving public

author: {'steamid': '76561198195171109', 'num_games_owned': 342, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 81, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 81, 'last_played': 1455675314}
review:
The highest score at the time of writing is tied between 10 people at 2,147,483,647.

For background, 2,147,483,647 is the highest an integer value can be on a 32-bit system, anything above this and things get a little broken. Assuming you can click 30 times a second which is double the world record that I could find in a 10 second search, it would take you about...

71,582,788 seconds, or
1,193,046 minutes, or
19,884 hours, or
828 days, or
1 year and 98 days.

And several days have been lost in rounding, and at the time of typing, the game has been out for one day.
In other words, you will never win.
Have fun!

review:
This game dude, not only is thuis masterpiece about god damn Mayonaise it even has a better love story than twilight the connection between the player and this jar of mayo is inseperable and imortal.
The story is amazing full of plot twists and ups and downs oh my its making me sweat just thinking about it, what im saying is you should get Michael Bay over here and interview this classy Mayo jar for a new film "The Fault In Our Mayo" story about a dying girl who finds love in the arms of a young handsome Mayo jar filled with yummy Mayo (No sexual reference).
belive me it will get all the awards.


Thank Me Later!!!!

P.S Buy This Game it will warm your heart and soul (if you belive in souls)

author: {'steamid': '76561198069747447', 'num_games_owned': 5753, 'num_reviews': 92, 'playtime_forever': 278, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 278, 'last_played': 1455669738}
review:
[b]10/10 Needs VR support!!! [/b]

Somewhat serious review: 

This is another clicker "game" (there are plenty of free ones if you don't know what it us). You need to click that mayo jar 10K times and... that's pretty much it. 

Currently on sale for $0.59. Worth it for me for a couple of laughs, about an hour of pointless clicking and overall stupidity. Just don't expect much from it. It is literally just clicking.
50 easy achievements and steam trading cards is a good bonus (and main reason most of the people will buy this game).

author: {'steamid': '76561198120417962', 'num_games_owned': 1078, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1455579912}
review:
Yet another "random=funny" game.
I use the term "game" very loosely.
The game consists of a jar of mayo,a really immature sense of "humour" and an abundance of achievements.
Listen, devs; I know you are trying to cash in with games similar to the title "Goat simulator" but honestly no one other than mindless ten year olds really enjoy games like that. Frankly we desire games with a good narrative, story and highly enjoyable gameplay not some pile of shite that leads to Repetitive strain injuries.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996001283', 'num_games_owned': 1523, 'num_reviews': 25, 'playtime_forever': 57, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 57, 'last_played': 1455647271}
review:
There are plenty games on Steam that are clearly intended to be "joke games" and nobody is supposed to take them serious - like Grass Simulator. At least THIS joke game isn't an insult, because its actually well made for what it is.

If you buy this game, expecting deep, interesting gameplay, you will be disappointed. If you want to maybe have a sensible chuckle and get a ton of achievements, this is your game.

You can also watch a full playthrough here and save your mouse: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3_CXGUweq2E

author: {'steamid': '76561197994316647', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 86, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1456344580}
review:
My Name is Mayo isn't a very complex game, but it can be somewhat enjoyable. I'm sure most of you have played or heard of 'clicker' games, and this isn't much different. But what makes My Name is Mayo shine, in my eyes, is that although it is short - and very much completable in under an hour - it plays with your expectations and integrates achievements into the game experience which is something a lot of games lack.

 Achievements are an integral part of the My Name is Mayo experience - as well as being the major goal in the game, and display your progress towards that goal, achievements also dictate what thread of the stories you'll follow next by selecting them in a menu. The more achievements you get, the more you can see of the game. This makes you care about the achievements as you'll be unlocking them often and jumping into the menu to see what you've unlocked -- and what you'll unlock next. The stories are very simplistic by themselves, but they tend to be random and funny in ways you'd not normally expect.

 And I think it scores some points on that, comedy is always welcome, and My Name Is Mayo ends up being a very good delivery system for it. But it does have its share of flaws.

 I think the biggest problem with My Name is Mayo is the fact that you're required to click a tad too much -- though the clicking does extend the feeling of wanting to see what will happen next, it quickly gets too tiresome when the game starts expecting you to click 200-300 times just to unlock the next part of the story. It also has no automation as well, and while it is not necessarily needed, I feel 10,000 clicks to unlock every achievement can be a pain on the wrists.

All in all, the inexpensive price more than matches the content, and I think the humor is worth it, but do yourself a favor and get an auto-click script or somethin'. Stay safe, use protection. Get out there and achieve Mayonnaise Nirvana.

author: {'steamid': '76561197986558934', 'num_games_owned': 7338, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 125, 'last_played': 1455641083}
review:
Vous √™tes un chasseur de succ√®s et/ou un collectionneur de cartes ? Ce jeu est exactement ce que vous cherchez : un prix tr√®s bas, un 100% faisable en 30 minutes environ et trois cartes valant, √† ce jour, 12 centimes chacune.

Si, au contraire, vous √™tes un joueur cherchant un concept farfelu √† la mani√®re d'un "Goat Simulator" ou d'un "I'am Bread", passez votre chemin, car vous allez √™tre extr√™mement d√©√ßu par ce clicker sans int√©r√™t.

Vous allez cliquer, cliquer... cliquer... et encore cliquer, sans jamais rien d√©bloquer, si ce n'est des succ√®s et des costumes pour votre pot de mayo qui n'entra√Ænent AUCUNE interaction, si on passe les 2/3 animations sur certains costumes qui permettent de retourner un troph√©e, ou de taper dans le mot "IT" pour qu'il d√©colle et sorte de l'√©cran. √Ä part √ßa, aucune √©volution au fil des clics sur le pot de mayo. Il ne s'ouvre pas, il ne bouge pas de son d√©cor bleut√©, il ne s'anime √† aucun moment, il ne se brise pas, il n'introduit pas de nouveaux √©l√©ments de gameplay, rien... woaw, on s'amuse.

En plus des costumes, vous d√©bloquerez parfois, √† partir d'un pallier de 10, 100, 1000 ou 5000 clics (et 46 tendinites), une petite anecdote de culture g√©n√©rale sur des sujets vari√©s tels que la taille du cerveau de l'Homme de N√©andertal, une particularit√© morphologique de l'enfant appr√©ci√© dans la Rome Antique, l'unicit√© des genoux de l'√©l√©phant... mais mon dieu... quel rapport avec le jeu ?

Si encore le jeu jouait la carte du ridicule "sens√©", en restant en coh√©sion avec son univers et en nous donnant des anecdotes sur la mayo : sa date de cr√©ation, le sens du mot dans des pays comme la Turquie (qui n'est pas le m√™me), des recettes avec lesquelles elle se marie bien etc., √ßa pourrait √™tre sympathique et nous d√©crocher un sourire... mais non ! On part dans des anecdotes WTF qui poussent le jeu dans des retranchements d'absurdit√© jamais atteints et d√©nu√©s de tout humour. Pourtant, l'humour est un point primordial dans ce genre de jeu... vous pensez s√©rieusement qu'on joue √† un concept aussi WTF pour autre chose que l'humour ? Quel int√©r√™t poss√®de "My Name is Mayo" si l'humour, pilier fondamental et immuable de ces jeux est pass√© √† la trappe ? Des jeux comme Goat Simulator et I'm Bread, pour reprendre mes exemples, l'avaient tr√®s bien compris... et ils ont r√©ussi √† se faire une place et une notori√©t√© dans le domaine des jeux WTF aupr√®s des joueurs gr√¢ce √† leur qualit√© de r√©alisation, certes, mais surtout gr√¢ce √† leur humour et une coh√©sion/unicit√© dans leur propre univers sans faille.

Une place que My Name is Mayo n'atteindra jamais, sans surprise ni h√©sitation.

author: {'steamid': '76561198252794594', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 102, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 102, 'last_played': 1455556639}
review:
TL;DR: Buy if you spare a dollar. Don't buy if you don't like clicker games.

[b]Price\quality:[/b] This game takes about an hour to finish, the normal price of this game is a dollar. The legal American minimum wage is 7.50, it's 8.05 in my state. I have a job so this means that I can easily afford 8 of these games within an hour (taxes not included). Money is not an issue to me. I actually enjoyed this game. I liked that it had an ending. I don't have an issue with clicker games or meme games so that's a major influence in my review.

I enjoy clicker games to a certain extent. I recognized that this game wasn't going to last long, but the art style and the achievements made up for it (I got all the achievements!). It's only a dollar. What can you buy for a dollar? Not an actual mayo jar, nope. That costs at least 3 dollars where I live (*estimation, I'll update this review once I see the actual price in-store). A dollar won't get you that much.

For a dollar I had a lot of fun. I'm a Youtuber so playing this for my channel was honestly hilarious, I was laughing a bunch of times. I made a livestream of it and some people came to watch me, I'll put the video at the end for those who want to watch the highlights.

I started playing this game with a blank slate of what I was expecting. The only thing I knew was that someone made this game and tried to make it their product towards the world. I do this every day with my own videos, it's already difficult as is with the market saturation.

[b]So does this game have enough originality to warrant a dollar?[/b] Yes. BUT. These are my personal preferences: I like story-driven games, I like games with endings, I have no issues with clickers, I like puns & memes, I love cats, I like mayo, [b]art style in-game is a big plus for me[/b] and I liked the design of the pots and the achievements, there were no bugs for me while playing this game, I had no problems with recording, I like indie games and although there are other free games like this, still I can't blame someone for asking less than the price of a real mayo jar for something they worked longer than an hour for to make.

https://youtu.be/mNE-wxYxSgI

author: {'steamid': '76561197974618029', 'num_games_owned': 2769, 'num_reviews': 40, 'playtime_forever': 186, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 186, 'last_played': 1455845790}
review:
I finished this so you don't have to. 

There is not much going on in this game:
You click about 18.500x (really, not an overstatement). 
And you get 100% achievement. 
Yes, that,s it. 

If you really really want 100% achievement + trading cards, you can have it for a low price of 1$ + new mouse + carpal tunnel syndrome treatment. 

notes: 
music: one loop of The Sims-like track. Very annoying.
graphics: one picture of mayo. Sometimes dressed in leopard bikini. 
warning: the game crashes when you hit Escape.
be aware: for achievements you have to switch to another "story" in a pause menu.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001876420', 'num_games_owned': 1434, 'num_reviews': 478, 'playtime_forever': 32, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1455618050}
review:
First off I just want to say: great Steam controller support! I will be uploading my config asap.

Four main storylines, ranging from topics such as identity crisis and sexual frustration. 
Multiple sidequests that all provide various levels of satisfaction and real life insight. 
The true ending is unlocked when you satisfy all achievements and is both inspirational and worthy of your time investment. 

Highly recommend especially at it's price sets a low bar for entry.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004481881', 'num_games_owned': 3327, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 127, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 127, 'last_played': 1455901376}
review:
"My Name is Mayo" est un clicker, un jeu qui ne repose que sur le fait de cliquer pour faire progresser l'histoire.
La majorit√© des clicker sont gratuits, car les seules choses qu'ils procurent au joueur sont en r√®gle g√©n√©rale des douleurs au poignet et l'envie d'installer un logiciel qui cliquera √† leur place. Voici donc ce que je retiendrai d'un des premiers clicker payants et dot√© d'√©valuations "Tr√®s positives" sur Steam d√®s le jour de sa sortie.

[b][u]Aspects positifs:[/u][/b]

‚úîÔ∏è R√©f√©rences sympathiques, nombreuses tentatives d'humour
‚úîÔ∏è Tenues √† d√©bloquer pour le pot de mayonnaise
‚úîÔ∏è Progression fa√ßon jeu de piste appuy√©e sur les succ√®s d√©bloqu√©s
‚úîÔ∏è 50 succ√®s tr√®s facilement d√©bloquables
‚úîÔ∏è Pr√©sence d'une morale √† la toute fin de "l'aventure"
‚úîÔ∏è Aucun DLC

[b][u]Aspects n√©gatifs:[/u][/b]

‚ùå N√©cessite au moins 10 000 clics pour le finir √† 100%
‚ùå Enjeux insuffisants pour nous garder motiv√©s √† cliquer aussi longtemps
‚ùå Audacieux choix que de faire payer un jeu aussi vide de contenu
‚ùå Leaderboard de la honte permettant de montrer votre... capacit√© √† cliquer comme un √¢ne?
‚ùå Bande-son quasi-inexistante
‚ùå Aucune rejouabilit√©

[b][u]Avis:[/u][/b]

Inenvisageable sans logiciel automatisant le clic, ce petit jeu n'aurait pas d√ª √™tre payant.
Pas fonci√®rement mauvais, il vous permet d'occuper un peu de temps libre en cliquant comme un d√©c√©r√©br√©, mais ne vous offrira rien de plus. Ne contient aucune notion didactique, pas la moindre recette, uniquement des allusions √† des r√©f√©rences culturelles d√©j√† vues et revues.
Termin√© en moins d'une demie-heure avec un auto-clicker, il sera vite oubli√© d√®s que j'aurai publi√© cette recommandation. S'il avait √©t√© gratuit, je vous aurais dit "Pourquoi pas, mais sans plus.". Sauf qu'il est payant.

[code]Vous cherchez d'autres √©valuations honn√™tes?

Passez une bonne journ√©e! :)[/code]

review:
[h1] SPOILER ALERT [/h1]

This game was magnificent. First I need to start off by saying i had to update my graphics card to even try to allow my pc to comprehend the next-gen graphics that this game had provided me. Second, this game needs a GOTY soon. For those intrested in playing this game just look at the silmilar titles, Fallout 4, Destiny, GTAV, even the Witcher III, these games are sub-par when put into a league that includes  My Name Is Mayo. Total steal for only DOLLAR!!! Multiple story modes, expert gaming mechanics. Excellent use of the Unreal Engine and its full capabilities. I don't know what game I was playing since every other review isn't great. This game was just an immaculate piece of work.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002750621', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 15, 'last_played': 1455602274}
review:
The hype machine behind big games often mirrors the precarious Icarus myth - fly too close to the sun, promise too much, and you're just as likely to tumble out of the sky as deliver on your potential. Green Lava Studios have promised so much with My Name is Mayo that it's hard to see how they could succeed, how they couldn't burn up in the harsh heat of audience expectation.

My Name is Mayo takes place in a future you can see from here. The world of My Name is Mayo meets somewhere between Blade Runner and Robocop caught between the utopia of revolutionary scientific discovery and the dystopia of the people inevitably left behind.

While My Name is Mayo can't be a revelation, it's an achievement nonetheless. It's a visionary, considered piece of work, and while my thoughts drift to the things that could have been and the compromises made due to the possibilities of video games in 2016, they're just as quick to consider playing through it again. My Name is Mayo is a smart and rewarding.

At the end of the day, yeah I beat it in one sitting and in like 10 min but I will not ask valve to refund my money for this. there are hints of love and passion dashed all around this game and I respect it for that.

9.5/10 wish there were actual tits in it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198261400298', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36, 'last_played': 1455681415}
review:
I was very on the fence about this one. Is not the purpose of a game to waste our time? Distract us from the crippling reality around us? This game definitely did that for me, but for about three minutes. I was so shocked to see this on the front page of Steam. It was on sale so I checked it out and I thought...hmm this cannot be for real...?
But oh it is, and I spent real money on this game. Money that I actually earned at a job. I would have been better off investing it. But I decided to throw it into the mayonnaise jar, and I don't even like mayonnaise. 

The whole point of this game is for the achievements. I'm an achievement whore so naturally I said hey now...
But my main gripe with this game is that I am almost 100% certain that it was meant to be a mobile app game. Without a doubt. You play a finger that just taps on the glass of the jar, to navigate the menu you have to slide it down. I can honestly say within the first five minutes of purchasing this game, I regretted it. But such is life. I do not recommend this game but you know, it is what it is.
If you don't mind throwing away 50-99 cents for this game for the achievements/badges/trading cards then pick it up.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202274332', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 35, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 35, 'last_played': 1455640190}
review:
As a child, I grew up not liking mayonaise. Tonight, I ate a burger with mayo on it. Also, tonight a good friend bought me this game as a gag. I have been playing nonstop, and it is worth every penny of that $0.59 discount, plus some. Clicking non-stop is the definition of fun in my opinion. I will likely develop RSI or some hand disorder, but I am sure I will die happy.

This game may lack superb graphics, but it is more competitive than any FPS shooter on the market.

Pros: nearly endless

Cons: also nearly endless

overall: If you have a dollar that you found at a gas station, or simply just want to pull a prank on a friend, I highly recommend this dank *** "game". It is my favorite title in my entire library.

Bless the souls of this game's creators.

author: {'steamid': '76561198045418880', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1474220255}
review:
My Name Is Mayo.
A story of love, betrayal, and overcoming hardships.
A riveting plot, full of action, romance, and intelligence.

Once you open this jar of mayonnaise, it will open you... and fill you with a sense of longing and desire; the kind of longing and desire that only a jar of mayo dressed in a leopard-print bikini can fill you with.
Free your mind, bask in a state of unprecedented self-awareness, and allow this game to transport you to a higher plane of existence, once thought only to exist in fantasy.

Mayo is love, mayo is life... My name is mayo.

10/10 - Would destroy my mouse and space bar again.

author: {'steamid': '76561197980449859', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 279, 'playtime_forever': 226, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1527554565}
review:
This mayo is 10,000 clicks delicious? Why am I clicking on mayo? Where did my 59 cents go? 

This is a game where you click on a bottle of mayo as it wears different outfits and experiences life? Except you use an autoclicker because you're a smart fellow. Even though you spent 59 cents on a mayo clicking game? 

This is the best game about mayo that I've ever played. It's like a Clicker game, except it ends once you do all the clicks. Enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561197977434623', 'num_games_owned': 1232, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 28, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1455583358}
review: This seems like a satire of a clicker game, like if The Colbert Report had focused on ponzi schemes in video games instead of politics. But by being satire this itself seems a bit of an underhanded way to get a buck off of consumers while providing a product that, although you may be in on the joke, is still crap. You click 10,000 times and some jokes of mild hilarity pass--not terribly funny after the first 2-3 and there are around 50. After said 10k clicks and selecting a few things from an achievement menu you've unlocked 50 achievements and a perfect game. If you want 50 more achievements and a perfect game in under 30 minutes for the price of $1, sure I get that; however, that is the only reason to purchase this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198040756411', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 65, 'playtime_forever': 29, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 29, 'last_played': 1455582252}
review:
[h1]Overview[/h1]
[i]My Name is Mayo[/i] is a short, click spam game where you click on a jar of mayo in order to uncover different stories told in one-liners that are also achievements. I will try to write this review as serious as possible, though... come on. This is meant to be a joke. (I hope!)

[h1]The Pros:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]It's a teeny bit fun[/b] - And by that I mean, it's so bad it's good. You get a chuckle during your first (an hopefully only playthrough)
[*][b]Great Gag Gift[/b] - When this goes on sale, it's half a buck. Not even a real jar of mayo can't beat that price. Send them to your friends before you give them the actual gift.
[*][b]Easy Achievements[/b] - Half an hour of clicking (I suggest making a click macro if you can, so as not to wear your mouse for no reason) and you get 50 easy achievements along with a perfect game!
[*][b]Trading Cards[/b] - At this point, every stupid game on Steam has these. Let them idle so you can at least return your investment a bit.
[*][b]Leaderboards?![/b] - This actually has a Steam Leaderboard that ranks you based on how many times you've tapped the mayo jar. Some of these entries (although clearly illicit) show just what people can do out of boredom.
[/list]

[h1]The Cons:[/h1]
[list]
[*][b]It costs money[/b] - While one buck is not going to break the bank, I can't think of any reason to spend it on this. There are loads other even stupider games that go for free. Unless you're in for the achievements and / or trading cards, go elsewhere.
[*][b]Could have been... longer?[/b] - Although I don't regret not being able to play this game more, it had the potential for the joke. Much more content could have been put in, even if it made it would make it in a cookie clicker clone.
[/list]

[h1]Conclusion:[/h1]
Seriously now, I love myself some occasional $h!ts and giggles, but at some point you have to draw the line between what should be somewhere on Newgrounds with a donate button, and an actual game for sale on Steam. There's nothing wrong with this game (apart from everything) but Steam just is not the place for it.

[table][tr][td]If you enjoyed this review and want to see more of my work, [b]consider joining my group[/b] and [b]follow my curator[/b] page! Link to the right![/td][td][url=http://steamcommunity.com/groups/jads_list]Jad's List - Curator Group[/url][/td][/tr][/table]

author: {'steamid': '76561198165910296', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 66, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 65, 'last_played': 1456112275}
review:
I paid like fifty cents for this game, so... fine.  You click on a jar of mayo (or just hit spacebar) ten thousand times, while it wears various outfits.  This isn't a game.  It might be art, but if so it's not art that appeals to me.  If anyone is curious, it's not worth getting to the "end".

Now that that's out of the way, let me mention for a moment that the people at the top of the leaderboards have one and a half BILLION mayo clicks.  That means someone went to the trouble of cheating at a pointless game... I'm not sure exactly what that says about humanity but I don't think it's good.

author: {'steamid': '76561198050283542', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 48, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1664084843}
review:
When you are subjected to a piece of art there are two things you must ask yourself: what is this piece trying to say, and what does it make me feel.

Throughout this game you experience the life of another. Their hopes and dreams, struggles with family and intimacy and finding one's self. This game carries a strong message; we are who we make ourselves.

Throughout the game you are rewarded, for the completion of mundane and banal tasks, brief glimpses into the main character's life. The games allows you to reflect upon yourself and attempts to guide you into the realization that it is only through experimentation and discovery that we can find our true selves.

We know what the game sets out to accomplish; what does it make us feel? I found myself profoundly changed after experiencing this game. I laughed, shuddered, got excited, leapt off my seat, and even wept. I feel that in the aftermath of this true piece of art there will come about a social change. I know that many, like myself, will have their view on life irrevocably altered.

I highly recommend this game and as such will give it a perfect score.
5/7 Can't wait for GOTY edition!

author: {'steamid': '76561198055150823', 'num_games_owned': 504, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1455576604}

review:

author: {'steamid': '76561197961553883', 'num_games_owned': 7378, 'num_reviews': 376, 'playtime_forever': 222, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 222, 'last_played': 1455659052}
review:
"Gameplay" for the first 5000 clicks: click click click (etc.) until the next story-related achievement pops up. Switch to it and repeat until the end is reached, then start over with a new story. There are four different ones in total.

"Gameplay" for the last three achievements: click another 5000 times...

Ugh.

Eays achievements (just a grind) and some silly humour. Since it's cheaper than a low ranking politician's bribe at the moment, why not?

author: {'steamid': '76561198055617662', 'num_games_owned': 163, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 15, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1456614717}
review:
Upon launching my Steam‚Ñ¢ client this afternnon, I was shocked to notice a game suggested to me under the label "My Name is Mayo". Intrigued by this captivating title, I gently moved my mouse reticle to the redirection box and clicked. Upon learning that this was of no substance and merely contained mind numbing drivel, I showed this to my friend to see if his reaction was akin to mine. Unfortunately, he proceeded to purchase this game and give it to me, much to my dismay. After thoroughly chastising him for this act, I decided to load it up to see if the game really had any flavor or challenge to it. After lightning loading it, I entered the game. As the first image loaded onto my screen, I was sent into a state of pure agony. I bolted out of my seat, ripping the earbuds from my head, causing a tearing of my ear cartilage. Bleeding, I dashed to my kitchen, grabbing a steak knife. I proceeded to return to my computer and firmly lodged the blade in the top of my monitor. I slowly and painfully dragged the knife through every LED on the way down, cleanly slicing the monitor in two. It was at this point I felt a compelling urge to click my mouse more. I realized that this game was not a piece of malware, or a virus. It was corruption at its finest. Death is better than this. This game has taught me that there is nothing left for me in this world but sadness and hopelessness. Despair will consume us all. 

All is lost.

author: {'steamid': '76561197998893232', 'num_games_owned': 162, 'num_reviews': 52, 'playtime_forever': 181, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1697209219}

author: {'steamid': '76561198099227424', 'num_games_owned': 561, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 211, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 211, 'last_played': 1455936327}
review:
What a magical game! 

The Story that revolves around wasting 59 cents, Then clicking 10,000 times to unlock the 50 achievements the game offers, which gets painful around 5,000 clicks, All the while getting some insight into the world of the beautiful and mysterious Mayo Jar. Trying Not to get too excited when you see her or him (it?) for the first time in that sexy bikini. 

This game lasts around 30 minutes maybe longer if you already have carpal tunnel syndrome or if you can't handle seeing naked jars. You might need to take breaks for a cold shower. 

When you finally reach the end of this tantalizing story, You feel a quick sense of accomplishment that you have yet another perfect game under your belt, Yet you realize you need to let this game run for another 4 hours to collect the cards still.. So you will walk away, And wonder what went wrong in your life that you spent 30 minutes clicking a picture of a mayo jar in a bikini & whip cream.

author: {'steamid': '76561198071848310', 'num_games_owned': 497, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 39, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 39, 'last_played': 1455568228}

author: {'steamid': '76561198141404871', 'num_games_owned': 910, 'num_reviews': 149, 'playtime_forever': 152, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 152, 'last_played': 1455584568}
review:
Hmmm ..... 50 extremely easy achievements and trading cards.  About an hour of playtime, maybe.  Depends on how long it takes one to click a total of 10000 times.  These are the main selling points to  clicking on a virtual jar of mayonnaise 10000 times for the asking price of $1 (US), half that price if ones runs into this game on sale.  The jar of mayonnaise does play at "dress up" along the way, just to be silly.  There are 4 absurd 'storylines' of one liners, and 12 accurate facts so the educational aspect is "covered".   

For achievement hunters and card collectors this game is probably worth the $1 (or less, if on sale).  For everyone else this game is just flat out stupid.  But hey, we humans like stupid sometimes.  Who am I to judge since I bought this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198006476640', 'num_games_owned': 7407, 'num_reviews': 348, 'playtime_forever': 67, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 67, 'last_played': 1455567996}

author: {'steamid': '76561198041142998', 'num_games_owned': 170, 'num_reviews': 64, 'playtime_forever': 310, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 310, 'last_played': 1455581525}
review: If you're into satire, and achievement hunting like me, then this is the perfect game for you. All you do is literally click a mayo jar 10,000 times to unlock various achievements and story paths (which are just reskins). Many people are butthurt over the fact that it is the only mechanic in the whole game. Seriously, the game was really just made to unlock achievements and 100% it in only 1 hour, not to mention the trading card drops. It's either love it or hate it, and just that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997089981', 'num_games_owned': 3227, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 282, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 282, 'last_played': 1455725282}
review:
[h1]People actually do call me Mayo in real life.[/h1]
10/10, having a game with the perfect name in my library is priceless!!

Now, for the actual review part:
There is a jar of Mayo, and you click on it. By clicking you unlock achievements, by activating/selecting certain achievements you can kind of follow a story through that achievement chain.

One downside, though: It's not like those clicker games where you buy upgrades so you cain even more cookies/points/gold from clicking. There is only a mayo jar, the music, your finger, and several outfits for the mayo jar.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046642155', 'num_games_owned': 14338, 'num_reviews': 128, 'playtime_forever': 128, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 128, 'last_played': 1527530309}
review:
So "My Name is Mayo" is a "game" about clicking on a virtual mayo jar... that's it.
It's basically a ripoff of an old (free) project from famous Indie-Dev Edmund McMillen. His game was called "AVGM" which stands for "Abusive Video Game Manipulation". It's even available as part of the "Basement Collection" here on Steam (it's a hidden game in there).
As it stands AVGM had an interesting message, which you can read on McMillen's Blog here:

http://edmundmcmillen.blogspot.de/2009/02/avgm-retrospective.html

So this game about the Mayo Jar here is basically exactly the same, but it's not a free game with a message like the one from Mr McMillen was... take from that what you want...

Well, at least you can quickly farm 100% achievements here... but that's about it.
Not recommended.

author: {'steamid': '76561197979215168', 'num_games_owned': 8053, 'num_reviews': 103, 'playtime_forever': 54, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 54, 'last_played': 1455557588}
review:
What is "My Name is Mayo"?

No long review here, it is just a clicker game in the purest sense. You click through various story branches where each next option requires you to click x more times after selecting the current achievement from the pause menu. While the story itself is interesting, it is not deep at all. The whole game is more a joke game, an anti-clicker game that is not as bad as the one in the Basement Collection,[1] but dull enough in gameplay terms that you need to reflect on your gaming habits. Do you play games for achievements? Great, grab this, click 10k times and have another 100 percent in under an hour! Do you play for fun? Then avoid this! Or if you really play it, take the lesson you get from it, which is how stupid clicker games really are, why they only work as idle games, and even then only as glorified Skinner boxes.

Graphics:
The graphics are like a flash game. There is not a wide variety, but the different mayo jar styles are humorously done.

Sound:
The sound consists of a forgettable track and minimalistic sound effects.

Gameplay:
Clicker. Without any gains from idling. 10k clicks (pause menu to choose storyline excluded) and you are done.

Recommended?
No, I can not recommend this at 59 cent, or the standard price of 99 cent. This is made to be a joke gift to your friends, but buying for yourself would be silly unless you go for achievements. But even then, you could have gotten games that are more fun and longer in the last sale.


[1] http://edmundmcmillen.blogspot.de/2009/02/avgm-retrospective.html - Thanks to freezing_rain for posting the link in his review http://steamcommunity.com/id/freezing_rain/recommended/434260/

review:
This game is great! i have finished the storys and played through them and they are rather enjoyable.
The game is priced at $.99 but is completely worth it.



PROS:
Great Story
Great Graphics
Absolutely Funny!


CONS:
Ends very quickly
No options menu (Can mute music)
Stuck in fullscreen unless you press Alt+Enter


In my opinion if you have afew extra cents in your steam wallet grab this game because it's fun just to play with.

author: {'steamid': '76561198005610307', 'num_games_owned': 3254, 'num_reviews': 87, 'playtime_forever': 138, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 42, 'last_played': 1458165400}
review:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KRvh-uysND8

My name is Mayo is a clicker game in which you click on the jar of mayonnaise to progress.
The story has some side quests in the options but the game will see you last 10,000 clicks to complete. I cheated and used an Auto-Clicker to progress through to save my fingers and RSI.

Positives:
Funny and charming
This mayonnaise is very wise and gives many tips
The jar is very stylish and has good dress sense
Achievements are abundant
Sound track is pretty good

Negatives:
Not much of a game to play
RSI
Pretty expensive considering the type of game. I could argue that it should be free even.
No Audio Sliders
No Windowed mode


I have trouble recommending this game; it‚Äôs an okay game if you can call it this. The problem is there is not much too it. I could only really see achievement hunters jumping out of their way to get this but other than that, the game has little game play value and offers a few tips here and there. It is funny but not funny enough to score the game a buy it now or even wait for a sale.

As much as I wanted to love the game I just could not get into it. 

Sinko de Mayo.

Score:  Skip it
